Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to file a formal complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX and TransUnion LLC for violations of federal consumer protection laws and regulations, as outlined below. 
15 U.S.C. 1611 : XXXX  XXXX XXXX and TransUnion have failed to adhere to the Truth in Lending Acts ( TILA ) provisions, which mandate accurate disclosures of credit terms to consumers. Misleading or incomplete reporting of financial obligations has had an adverse impact on my credit report and access to credit. 

15 U.S.C. 1602 : Both entities have failed to ensure the transparency and accuracy of credit transactions as required by this statute, which defines key terms and obligations under TILA.

15 U.S.C. 1691 ( a ) : I believe XXXX  XXXX XXXX has engaged in discriminatory practices in violation of the Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ). This section prohibits creditors from discriminating against any applicant based on factors unrelated to creditworthiness. 

12 CFR 1002.4 : XXXX  XXXX XXXX failed to notify me of adverse actions or provide clear, written reasons for decisions affecting my credit application or account. 

12 CFR 1002.2 : TransUnion has provided inaccurate or misleading credit report data, resulting in adverse actions against me, including potential denial or higher costs of credit. 

TransUnion LLC v. Ramirez, 594 U.S. ( 2021 ) : TransUnion 's conduct demonstrates a disregard for consumer rights, as highlighted in the Supreme Courts ruling. Their failure to meet the FCRAs requirements regarding accuracy and disclosure of consumer data directly impacts my credit standing. 

Details of the Complaint XXXX  XXXX XXXX and TransUnion LLC have collectively contributed to errors and misrepresentations in my credit report. Despite my attempts to resolve these issues, the following concerns remain unaddressed : Failure to Correct Inaccurate Reporting : TransUnion continues to report erroneous information on my credit report, leading to adverse actions against me. 
Lack of Proper Notification : XXXX  XXXX XXXX has failed to notify me of adverse actions or provide sufficient explanations for their decisions. 
Failure to Ensure Maximum Accuracy : TransUnion has not upheld its obligation under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) to ensure the accuracy of consumer reports, as required under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ).

Requested Resolution I request the CFPB to : Conduct a full investigation into XXXX XXXX XXXX  and TransUnion LLCs actions.

Require TransUnion to immediately correct inaccuracies on my credit report and provide evidence of compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ).

Require XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX to provide clear documentation of their adverse actions and verify compliance with ECOA and related regulations.

Levy appropriate penalties for noncompliance to ensure accountability and prevent similar misconduct in the future.

Supporting Documentation I have attached copies of my credit report, correspondence with XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX and TransUnion, and any additional documentation to support this complaint. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I trust that the CFPB will take appropriate action to uphold my rights under federal law and ensure accountability for these violations. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated my rights. 

I looked at my XXXX credit report on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX ( and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

I reported that my address was reporting incorrectly a long with other information and in less than 24 hours a decision was made that the address would stay on my report. I gave them documents that proved my address was wrong but they still updated it to be correct. I am a victim of fraud and identity theft I have been trying to get the inaccurate information removed from my report for years at this point, I have had no success working with the credit bureau. I would like my report to reflect the accurate information ONLY.

Incomplete, inaccurate information or unverifiable must be removed in 30 days PER 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., governs access to consumer credit report records and promotes accuracy, fairness, and the privacy of personal information assembled by Credit Reporting Agencies.

Incomplete and inaccurate information

Product: Mortgage
Sub-product: Home equity loan or line of credit (HELOC)
Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Sub-issue: Confusing or misleading advertising or marketing
Consumer complaint narrative:
Button Finance kept stringing me along for months assuring me I was getting a HELOC approved when it was actually a 2nd mortgage and when the Notary appeared at my home for signing ; I called XXXX at Button and he simply stated " that's the way the Title company processed the paperwork " and that was unacceptable so I did not sign the paperwork and he called me a " clown '' for not signing the paperwork and told him he's a con artist. 

I also questioned some of the fees in which I provided paperwork for like access to my credit reports and employment verification information. He just could provide reasoning for some of the fees so I refused to sign and he also had my Homeowners insurance company put Button down on my coverage as a mortgagee which was inappropriate when I have not signed any paperwork yet.
Company public response: Company disputes the facts presented in the complaint

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Problem with rewards from credit card
Consumer complaint narrative:
My significant other and I have been planning a trip to XXXX XXXX and XXXX for a few months. On XX/XX/year> Chase Bank offered a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Points ( see attached ). XXXX XXXX XXXX travel with XXXX XXXX and they have a published redemption chart with the reward points needed for travel on XXXX XXXX to get from XXXX to XXXX XXXX or XXXX, XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX points are needed for a round trip first class ticket ( see attached ). 

I attempted to search for seats and an error came up saying no seats were found. Then I called XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/year> to see if they could find flights. They asked for my XXXX XXXX account and told me they could not look until the points were in my account. 

On XX/XX/year> XXXX points from my Chase Rewards account were transferred to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account for a total of XXXX points ( more than enough points to cover XXXX first class cabin seats on XXXX per XXXX 's redemption chart ). Once they were in the account, the customer service agent told me that no flights on XXXX available as requested. 

I asked about refunding the points, and this was not possible. Called Chase, and found that this was not possible ( as they state all transfers are final ). 

I then read the " small print '' on XXXX XXXX redemption site stating that redemption of XXXX XXXX XXXX points are not available on XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX and XXXX ( see attached ). The other planes in their fleet ( where points can be used ), the XXXX, XXXX and XXXX do not have a first class accommodation ( see attached ). 

I have enough XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX points to book XXXX first class seats on XXXX XXXX from XXXX ( XXXX  ) to XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX ) but this flight will never be offered because XXXX XXXX only flies XXXX, XXXX and XXXX aircraft on this route. These aircraft are excluded from the XXXX XXXX redemption via the " small print '', and first class accommodations do not exist on XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX and XXXX. 

It is unreasonable for XXXX XXXX to expect the general consumer to know that first class seating does not exist on the flights you can book on XXXX XXXX via their flying club. Therefore they devalued the points significantly because the only way to redeem points with XXXX XXXX is to take multiple connections with multiple airlines, and you can not ever get thefirst class seat theyhave advertised. 

They falsely advertise what appears to be an amazing award ( First Class round trip with XXXX XXXX for only XXXX points ) because they exclude planes that have first class, and first class does not exist on the remaining aircraft in XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

If I would have transferred my points XXXX to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ), I could have booked round trip direct business class accommodations for me and my significant other XXXX points each. I was persuaded by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX transfer offer to then get a first class seat ( not business class ) for only XXXX points roundtrip. My points are now stuck and devalued in the XXXX XXXX XXXX club. 

This is blatant fraud. Essentially the same as saying " XXXX points to travel to the moon, but all spacecraft are excluded from this redemption. '' A great offer that is impossible to book because you can't take a passenger jet to the moon. 

You can not advertise something that does not exist, and then entice customers with XXXX points transfersvia a permanent transferof points. Both ( XXXX XXXX XXXX parties are culpable and probably in cahoots.I do not believe XXXX XXXX has any culpability in this matter.

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Urgent Complaint Regarding Missing Funds and ACH Deposits Simple/BBVA/PNC Transition Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau , I am writing to formally complain about the handling of my Simple Online Bank Account , which was backed by BBVA USA and later acquired by PNC Bank. Following the transition, I have been unable to access my funds or locate incoming ACH deposits from the U.S. Treasury ( IRS ), as detailed below : 1. - I was a customer of Simple Bank, whose accounts were serviced by BBVA USA. Simple Bank closed its operations around XX/XX/XXXX, and customers were informed that their accounts would transition to BBVA USA while maintaining the same routing and account numbers. 
- At the time of closure, my account had cash, which I initially wrote off as a loss after BBVA USA claimed no record of my account during a subsequent inquiry.

2. - Upon reviewing my IRS transcripts for XXXX and XXXX, I discovered multiple ACH deposits ( amounts and dates available ) that were sent by the IRS to my Simple/BBVA account 's routing and account numbers.

- These deposits were not returned as undeliverable, according to my IRS records, yet I never received the funds.

3. - I contacted BBVA USA and PNC Bank multiple times but was informed that there were no records of my Simple Online Bank Account, despite BBVA USA being the servicer of those accounts.

- My Simple Bank debit card was inactive and destroyed during the time of these missing deposits, further confirming I could not have accessed or withdrawn these funds.

4. - In XX/XX/XXXX, I IRS told me that they had to initiate a trace on the missing deposits. However, they have not provided any resolution or explanation for the missing funds.

5. - As a long-standing customer of Simple Bank with a clear paper trail of my account activity, I demand that the involved entities ( Simple, BBVA USA , PNC Bank , or the IRS ) locate and return my funds immediately. 
- If no action is taken, I will file police reports and consider legal proceedings for fraud, theft or mishandling of my finances. 

**Supporting Documentation** : - IRS transcripts from XXXX and XXXX showing the ACH deposits. 
- Proof of my Simple Bank account details, including the routing and account numbers. 
- Correspondence with BBVA USA, PNC Bank representatives and the IRS regarding this matter. 

This situation has caused significant financial and emotional distress. I urge your office to investigate this matter urgently and hold the responsible parties accountable. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Regarding the XXXX statement dated XXXX an erroneous interest charge has been applied to my account for {$2.00}.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, New Jersey XXXX Account # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Attention : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX Per the Federal Credit Reporting Act as a federally protected consumer, per 15 USC 6802 XXXX XXXX, I am now OPTING OUT of ANY AND ALL Authorization I, the consumer may have given to XXXX XXXX, XXXX written, unwritten, verbal or non-verbal to report my nonpublic personal information. 

XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX.violates the Privacy Act of 1974 as well as 12 CFR 1022.24 Reasonable opportunity to opt-out because I was never notified by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX.that my nonpublic personal information was going to be shared with non-affiliated third parties such as MIDLAND CREDIT XXXX Promotional Inquiry, I was NEVER GIVEN THE CHANCE TO OPT OUT. Also, 15 USC 6508 states that I have the option to opt out of any account reported to my credit report and I am supposed to receive an opt-out notice every thirty ( 30 ) days which XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX never sent to me. I am exercising my rights under 16 CFR 313.7 Form of opt-out notice to consumers. 

XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX.violated the terms and conditions within their banking agreement, because XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX states that they do not provide consumer information to third parties which they violated by reporting my nonpublic personal information to the credit reporting agencies listed above. According to 15 USC 6802 B ) I am supposed to receive THREE disclosures before my nonpublic personal information is shared but I never received notice. XXXX XXXX, XXXX.ALSO unlawfully sold this debt to a third party AFTER the debt had already been tendered in accordance with UCC 3-603 et al. I have never had a contract or agreement with any third parties and I do NOT consent to them reporting any account to my credit report. I am invoking all rights under OPT OUT and to Privacy protected by 15 USC 6802 B, 12 CFR 1022.24, 15 USC 6508, 16 CFR 313.7, the Privacy Act of 1974 et al. Please see 15 USC 6802 B ) OPT OUT below. A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless ( A ) such financial institution clearly and conspicuously discloses to the consumer, in writing or in electronic form or other form permitted by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, that such information may be disclosed to such third party ; ( B ) the consumer is given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and ( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. Finally, XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX.is in clear violation of 15 USC 45 - Unfair methods of competition for their failure to update the records after receiving tender of the full balance of the debt in accordance with the Electronic Funds Transfer Act as well as their acts of securities fraud and Tax evasion which I intend to report XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX via IRS form XXXX. To conclude, the above-listed credit reporting agencies are in violation of 15 USC 1681 sec 604a section 2, because it states that a Consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account w/o my written instruction. I did NOT give consent nor written instruction to report the XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX.account XXXX and supporting nonpublic personal information such as the transaction history and balance. Also, The credit reporting agencies are in violation of 15 USC 1681 sec 604a section 2, because it states that a Consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account w/o my written instruction. I did NOT give consent nor written instruction to any credit agency to report my nonpublic personal information. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate and Potentially Fraudulent Accounts on Experian Credit Report Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally dispute the following items reported on my Experian credit file. These accounts are either inaccurate, unverified, or potentially linked to a data breach affecting my personal information. I request that these accounts be thoroughly investigated and, if found unverifiable or erroneous, removed from my credit report immediately. 

Disputed Accounts : XXXX XXXXXXXX : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), I am entitled to dispute any inaccurate or unverifiable information on my credit report. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), Experian is obligated to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the data they report. 

Given the recent national data breach affecting credit-related institutions, I believe some of these accounts were fraudulently opened or inaccurately reported. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I request confirmation once your investigation is complete and action is taken. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Reporting and Request for 1099-C Documentation To Whom It May Concern, I am disputing the accuracy of an account listed on my credit report under 15 USC 1681s-2 , which mandates the reporting of accurate and verifiable information.

The account in question is as follows : 1. Account Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date Listed : XXXX. XXXX, XXXX  The balance currently being reported is inaccurate and potentially unlawful. Per Gugger v. USAA Federal Bank, the issuance of a 1099-C form by a creditor indicates the occurrence of an identifiable event of debt cancellation. Under IRS regulations, Event Code 7 defines such an event as a discharge of indebtedness due to the creditors policy decision to cease collection activity and cancel the debt. 

If a 1099-C form has been issued for this account, the debt has been canceled, and reporting a balance is inaccurate and misleading. I am requesting the following : Verification of the Account Balance : Provide evidence demonstrating that the balance is accurate and collectible. 

Provision of the 1099-C Form : If issued, provide a copy to verify the identifiable event.

Immediate Deletion of the Account : If the debt was discharged under Event Code 7 or can not be verified, you are required to delete this negative information under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 

Attached, you will find [ list of supporting documents ]. Please investigate this matter within the legally required 30-day timeframe. Failure to respond appropriately will result in further action. 

Thank you for your prompt attention. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to express my extreme dissatisfaction and concern regarding the unresolved status of my previous dispute about unauthorized inquiries on my credit report, which I submitted on [ XX/XX/year> ] and followed up on [ XX/XX/year> ]. This is my final attempt to resolve this matter amicably. I demand an immediate resolution in accordance with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ). 
Unauthorized Inquiries in Question XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) requires an immediate investigation of disputed information. It has been more than 30 days since my initial dispute, and I have yet to receive an adequate resolution, which is unacceptable. 
Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) entitles me to access all information in my file, including the results of your investigation. To date, I have not received the required information, which constitutes a violation of my rights. 
Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. These inquiries were made without my consent and do not meet any permissible purpose under this section, representing a serious infraction. 
Immediate Action Required I demand immediate action to resolve this dispute. Specifically, I request the following : 1. Thorough and Immediate Reinvestigation : Conduct a complete and urgent reinvestigation of the unauthorized inquiries.

2. Immediate Removal of Unauthorized Inquiries : Remove any inquiries found to be unauthorized from my credit report without delay.

3. Updated Credit Report : Provide me with an updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes immediately.

4. Detailed and Documented Notification : Inform me in detail of the steps taken and the results of your investigation within 15 days of receipt of this letter. Include documentation supporting your actions. 
Warning of Legal Action If I do not receive a satisfactory resolution within the specified timeframe, I will escalate this issue to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and proceed with legal action to protect my rights as a consumer. I will not hesitate to seek compensation for any damages resulting from your failure to adequately resolve this matter. 
I expect your immediate response and resolution to this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against Experian regarding their failure to resolve disputes and properly address unverifiable or inaccurate information on my credit report. Despite following the proper dispute process, Experian has allowed certain creditor accounts to remain on my credit report without timely verification or removal, as required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Specifically : 1. I have disputed several accounts, requesting verification of their accuracy and validity.

2. The creditor companies associated with these accounts have failed to comply with their own policies and the legal requirements to provide verification in a timely manner.

3. Experian has not taken appropriate action to remove these unverified accounts from my credit report despite clear evidence of non-compliance by the creditors.

These unresolved issues have caused harm to my creditworthiness and financial standing. I provided Experian with all the necessary details and supporting documentation, including certified dispute letters and proof of delivery, but I have not received adequate resolution.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the incorrect reporting of late payments on my credit file for the following accounts : XXXX. XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( Late Pay ) XXXX. XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( Late Pay ) These late payment notations are inaccurate and violate multiple provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), and relevant regulations. I am requesting an immediate investigation and the removal of these incorrect entries to ensure compliance with federal law. 

Violations of Federal Law 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 15 U.S. Code 1681a ( 2 ) ( xi ) : Credit reporting agencies and furnishers must ensure that all information included in a consumers credit file is accurate and verifiable. Reporting unverifiable or inaccurate late payments breaches this standard.

15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 : Furnishers of information are legally required to report accurate data and promptly correct errors when notified.

2. Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : 15 U.S. Code 1666 ( b ) : Billing errors, including misreported late payments, must be thoroughly investigated and resolved by creditors. Failure to comply with this requirement constitutes a direct violation of federal law.

3. Regulations Implementing TILA : 12 CFR 1026.13 : This regulation outlines the obligations of creditors to investigate and resolve billing disputes, including errors in reporting late payments. Noncompliance with this regulation is subject to penalties.

Damages and Remedies If these inaccuracies are not corrected promptly, I reserve the right to seek remedies under the following provisions : Statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation under FCRA ( 15 U.S. Code 1681n and 1681o ).

Actual damages resulting from the inaccuracies, including higher interest rates, credit denials, and emotional distress.

Punitive damages for willful noncompliance.

Recovery of legal fees and associated costs related to pursuing this matter.

Action Requested I am requesting that : 1. A comprehensive investigation be conducted for the accounts listed above in compliance with FCRA and TILA.

2. All inaccurate late payment entries be promptly removed from my credit report.

3. A written confirmation of the resolution be sent to me within 30 days, as required by 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ).

Next Steps I trust that your team will handle this matter with the seriousness it deserves and resolve it promptly. If this issue is not corrected, I will be compelled to file complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and other relevant regulatory agencies. Additionally, I will consult legal counsel to pursue remedies under the law for the harm caused by these inaccuracies. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

My account with XXXX XXXX XXXX AND DEPT OF ED/XXXX was never late! I have had exceptional payment history witH XXXX  XXXX and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment.

I demand the late payment reported in to be removed.

They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX AND DEPT OF ED/XXXX never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. 

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! 

Delete the late payments from my consumer reports

Consumer complaint narrative:
Notice to an agent is notice to the principal. 

I am writing in response to your letter dated XX/XX/year>, regarding my complaint filed with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). Your response, which included a signed agreement and a payment statement, does not fulfill my explicit request for critical information. 

On XX/XX/year>, I sent you a letter requesting specific account details, which remain unaddressed in your response. For clarity, I will reiterate my request : 1. The date of first delinquency for the account.

2. The date of the last payment made on the account.

3. The date of the charge-off.

This information is essential to validate the accuracy of the information reported on my consumer report. As you are aware, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ), the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1692 ), the Truth in Lending Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1601 ), and Title 18 of the United States Code, you are legally obligated to provide verifiable documentation that substantiates the accuracy of the information being furnished. Failure to provide such documentation constitutes a violation of my consumer rights.

Furthermore, your continued failure to provide the requested information may also implicate Title 18 U.S.C. 1028A, Aggravated Identity Theft, as the lack of validation for the account 's accuracy raises concerns about potential misuse of my personal information. 

I reiterate that a signed agreement does not justify or validate what is being reported on my credit file. Validation requires verifiable evidence confirming the specific dates and details requested. Your response has not fulfilled this legal standard, nor does it close this matter. 

If you fail to provide the requested information within 10 calendar days of your receipt of this correspondence, I will file a civil suit in good faith to seek damages for your violations of my consumer rights under the aforementioned laws. 

This is your final notice. I trust you will take the necessary steps to comply promptly.

According to my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ), I demand an immediate resolution. 
Unauthorized Inquiries in Question : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) requires a prompt investigation of disputed information. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate and fraudulent information being reported on my credit file. As per FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), I am requesting the immediate removal of the following information that has resulted from identity theft : Account : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Inquiries : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Relevant Provisions of FCRA 605B Under the FCRA, a consumer reporting agency must block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as resulting from identity theft. Specifically : 1. Timely Action Required : According to FCRA 605B ( a ), Experian must block the disputed information no later than four business days after receiving the following : Proof of my identity. 

A copy of my identity theft report. 

Identification of the fraudulent information. 

A statement from me asserting that the information is not the result of any transaction I authorized. 



2. Notification Obligation : As required by FCRA 605B ( b ), Experian must promptly notify the furnishers of the information about the identity theft claim, the requested block, and the effective dates of the block.

3. Limits on Declining or Rescinding the Block : Experian may only decline or rescind a block under very specific circumstances, as outlined in FCRA 605B ( c ). Any decision to decline or rescind a block must be accompanied by prompt notification to me, including an explanation as required by FCRA 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ).

Action Requested I demand the following actions : 1. Immediate removal of the fraudulent account and inquiries identified above.

2. Notification to all furnishers of the fraudulent nature of the account and inquiries.

3. Written confirmation within 30 days that the disputed information has been removed or blocked, as required under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). 



Next Steps Failure to comply with this request will result in formal complaints being filed with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and other regulatory agencies. Additionally, I reserve the right to seek legal counsel to pursue remedies under federal law, including damages for violations of the FCRA and any other applicable statutes. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to express my serious concern regarding the lack of resolution for my previous dispute about unauthorized inquiries on my credit report, which I submitted on XX/XX/XXXX. According to my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ), I demand an immediate resolution. 
Unauthorized Inquiries in Question : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) requires a prompt investigation of disputed information. I submitted my dispute and have yet to receive an adequate resolution.

Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) grants me the right to access all information in my file, including the results of your investigation. To date, I have not received the required information.

Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. These inquiries were made without my consent and do not meet any permissible purpose under this section.

Immediate Request : I demand immediate action to resolve this dispute. Specifically, I request the following : Thorough Reinvestigation : Conduct a thorough reinvestigation of the unauthorized inquiries. 
Removal of Unauthorized Inquiries : Remove any inquiries found to be unauthorized from my credit report. 
Updated Credit Report : Provide me with an updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes. 

Enclosed are copies of my previous dispute letter and a copy of my identification for verification purposes.

I am writing to express my extreme dissatisfaction and concern regarding the unresolved status of my previous dispute about unauthorized inquiries on my credit report, which I submitted on [ XX/XX/year> ] and followed up on [ XX/XX/year> ]. This is my final attempt to resolve this matter amicably. I demand an immediate resolution in accordance with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ). 
Unauthorized Inquiries in Question XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) requires an immediate investigation of disputed information. It has been more than 30 days since my initial dispute, and I have yet to receive an adequate resolution, which is unacceptable.

Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) entitles me to access all information in my file, including the results of your investigation. To date, I have not received the required information, which constitutes a violation of my rights.

Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. These inquiries were made without my consent and do not meet any permissible purpose under this section, representing a serious infraction.

Immediate Action Required I demand immediate action to resolve this dispute. Specifically, I request the following : 1. Thorough and Immediate Reinvestigation : Conduct a complete and urgent reinvestigation of the unauthorized inquiries.

2. Immediate Removal of Unauthorized Inquiries : Remove any inquiries found to be unauthorized from my credit report without delay.

3. Updated Credit Report : Provide me with an updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes immediately.

Warning of Legal Action If I do not receive a satisfactory resolution within the specified timeframe, I will escalate this issue to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and proceed with legal action to protect my rights as a consumer. I will not hesitate to seek compensation for any damages resulting from your failure to adequately resolve this matter. 
I expect your immediate response and resolution to this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate reporting of a late payment on my credit report. The account in question, under the name XXXX XXXX, is erroneously listed as having a late payment for XXXX. This is incorrect, as the payment was made on time and in accordance with the accounts terms. 

Pursuant to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), it is the responsibility of consumer reporting agencies to ensure that all information reported is accurate and complete. The reporting of a late payment on this account is neither. This account has never been late, and the record must reflect that fact. 

I have enclosed a copy of my credit report highlighting the disputed item. I demand that you investigate this matter thoroughly, correct this inaccuracy, and delete the erroneous late payment from my record without delay. 

Please provide written confirmation of the results of your investigation and any corrective action taken.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Consumer complaint narrative: The creditor ( Bridge Crest ) reported a Late Payment and put my credit account in Derogatory status on XX/XX/year>. I called them and requested a payment plan due to the hardship of my brother passing away and having to assist with funeral costs. I had to help other family members with funeral expenses as no one suspects death or an emergency of some sort, so in this case, I called to arrange my auto loan payment, and they recorded all the calls. So I did follow through with my set arrangements and the amounts I was told to pay made them aware of what I could pay and called when I needed to make further arrangements, and they said ( the customer service representative ) Bridge Crest got the payment late and stated due to my bank issuing time which I'm not accountable for it in some cases take the banks up to 3 days to release funds, and when Bridge Crest receive their payment it also take them 2-3 to collect but the Posted date is unchangeable and I have no control over this. I sent payment on the day asked and was told I wouldn't be under threat of a 30-day late payment credit reporting because the amount would help my interest as well as payment, a few days later, I got a notification a derogatory statement was reported on my credit report and unfortunately, it was BridgeCrest again they record their calls and they claimed that this matter happened because of timing then another time they stated because the car note was not paid in full which was lacking XXXX dollars. They made arrangements with me to ensure my complete coverage of the full car note for that billing cycle and no reporting to the credit bureaus, I feel that they violated my consumer rights under coding as the late payment coding15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( a ) and15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( b ), as well and I feel that wasn't a reason to report me and I was assured this per recorded calls I wouldn't be affected and I asked them to review the calls and this would assure confirmation. They ( the customer service team ) and the department that handles supervision complaints stated they would review but it was internal that it would be handled inside the company so basically if they found what I said to be true I wouldn't know. I hope that you find my complaint worthy of investigation. Also please assist with removing that derogatory late payment as that has depleted my score tremendously and is stopping me from trying to apply for home buyers to provide stability for my family and me a place to live, I feel they treated me unfairly as I am a loyal consistent paying customer. I have all documents supporting these facts along with copies of all the documents sent to all three bureaus and Creditors which have been uploaded. Respectfully yours, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
hello i have recently reviewed my credit file with experian regarding XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX acct # XXXX. 

i have submitted multiple disputes requesting investigstion and an ACCURATE reporting. experian comes back with " updated '' or " verified '' but it remains inaccurate. i asked if they can not provide proof they were verified and ACCURATE that they DELETE this account.it was disputed under XXXX, XXXX, XXXX. 

THE BURDEN OF PROOF IS ON EXPERIAN TO SECURE THE 100 % ACCURATE INFORMATIN AND THEY HAVE NOT DONE THIS. THIS IS CAUSING DAMAGES TO MY CREDIT SCORE AND IMPACTING MY ABILITY TO OBTAIN A MORTGAGE WITH MY FIANCEE.

INACCURACIES : 1- THE BALANCE IS WRONG 2- THE CO STATUS CONTINUES TO REPORT MONTH OVER MONTH EXTENDING THE STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS. THIS IS WRONG.

3- REP0SSESSION IS CITED 3 MONTHS IN A ROW : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. THIS IS WRONG. 

they have not deleted it but continue to report THIS ERRONEOUS ACCOUNT. this is a violation of the following : 15 U.S. Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( a ) In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. ( I HAVE PROVIDED WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS TO DELETE IF INACCURACIES WILL NOT BE AMENDED ) 15 U.S. Code 1681e - Compliance procedures ( a ) Identity and purposes of credit users Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. These procedures shall require that prospective users of the information identify themselves, certify the purposes for which the information is sought, and certify that the information will be used for no other purpose. Every consumer reporting agency shall make a reasonable effort to verify the identity of a new prospective user and the uses certified by such prospective user prior to furnishing such user a consumer report. No consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report to any person if it has reasonable grounds for believing that the consumer report will not be used for a purpose listed in section 1681b of this title.

( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. ( THE ACCOUNT REPORTING REMAINS INACCURATE ) 15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy ( a ) Reinvestigations of disputed information ( 1 ) Reinvestigation required ( A ) In general Subject to subsection ( f ) and except as provided in subsection ( g ), if the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumers file at a consumer reporting agency is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the agency directly, or indirectly through a reseller, of such dispute, the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from the file in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or reseller.

( 2 ) Prompt notice of dispute to furnisher of information ( B ) Provision of other information The consumer reporting agency shall promptly provide to the person who provided the information in dispute all relevant information regarding the dispute that is received by the agency from the consumer or the reseller after the period referred to in subparagraph ( A ) and before the end of the period referred to in paragraph ( 1 ) ( A ). (
EXPERIAN DID NOT PROVIDE ME WITH NAMES/PHONE NUMBERS/EMAIL OF INDIVIDUAL ( S ) WITH WHOM THEY ALLEGEDLY VERIFIED THIS ACCOUNT DURING **ANY** OF THE MULTIPLE INVESTIGATIONS. ) ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to express my serious concern regarding the lack of resolution for my previous dispute about unauthorized inquiries on my credit report, which I submitted on XX/XX/year>. According to my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ), I demand an immediate resolution. 
Unauthorized Inquiries in Question : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) requires a prompt investigation of disputed information. I submitted my dispute and have yet to receive an adequate resolution.

Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) grants me the right to access all information in my file, including the results of your investigation. To date, I have not received the required information.

Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. These inquiries were made without my consent and do not meet any permissible purpose under this section.

Immediate Request : I demand immediate action to resolve this dispute. Specifically, I request the following : Thorough Reinvestigation : Conduct a thorough reinvestigation of the unauthorized inquiries.

Removal of Unauthorized Inquiries : Remove any inquiries found to be unauthorized from my credit report.

Updated Credit Report : Provide me with an updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes.

Enclosed are copies of my previous dispute letter and a copy of my identification for verification purposes.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint because Experian has repeatedly failed to investigate and remove fraudulent accounts and outdated personal information on my credit report, in direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). These inaccuracies are a result of identity theft stemming from the XXXX data breach. 

The fraudulent accounts that remain on my Experian credit report are : XXXX XXXX, XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. XXXX These accounts were opened fraudulently without my consent. Both XXXX and XXXX have already investigated and deleted these accounts from my credit report. However, Experian continues to report them as " verified, '' without providing proof of a proper investigation or any supporting documentation. 

Additionally, Experian has failed to remove outdated and fraudulent addresses associated with these accounts, including : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, CA XXXX XXXX Arizona XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX NY XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX PA XXXX These addresses are not mine and are directly tied to the fraudulent activity. I have provided Experian with updated government-issued identification and documentation proving my claims, yet they continue to refuse to act, obstructing my ability to repair my credit profile. 

Experians failure to investigate and correct these inaccuracies has caused harm to my creditworthiness, emotional distress, and financial opportunities. Their negligence violates the FCRA, which requires credit reporting agencies to conduct thorough investigations and remove unverifiable or inaccurate information.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX XX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX **Subject : ** Formal Complaint Against XXXX XXXX XXXX for Inaccurate Credit Reporting Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau , I am writing to file a formal complaint against XXXX  XXXX XXXX for ongoing and inaccurate reporting of a closed account on my credit report. Despite this account being closed, XXXX XXXX continues to report balance updates, which is both misleading and in violation of the **Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) **. These inaccuracies are negatively affecting my credit standing and causing significant distress. 

**Details of the Issue : ** - The account in question ( Account Number : XXXX ) has been closed ; however, XXXX  XXXX XXXX continues to update the balance as though the account is active. This is inaccurate and constitutes false reporting under the FCRA. 
- This repeated inaccuracy has been reported to credit bureaus ( Experian, XXXX, and XXXX ) but remains unresolved. 

The FCRA requires that all information reported to credit bureaus be accurate, complete, and up to date. XXXX XXXX  failure to correct this issue is a clear violation of my rights under federal law. As a result, I am requesting immediate action by the CFPB to address this matter. 

**Resolution Requested : ** 1. I demand that this account be **immediately removed** from all three credit reports ( Experian, XXXX, and XXXX ) due to its inaccurate and misleading reporting. 
XXXX. I request that XXXX XXXX XXXX cease all further reporting of this account and any related balance updates. 

Failure to resolve this issue promptly will result in my pursuit of legal action, including seeking damages for each inaccuracy related to this account, as permitted under the FCRA. 

**Supporting Documentation : ** Enclosed are the following documents to support my complaint : - A copy of my recent credit report showing the inaccurate reporting. 
- Documentation confirming the accounts closed status. 

I trust the CFPB will take immediate and appropriate action to ensure compliance with federal regulations and protect my rights as a consumer. Please confirm receipt of this complaint and provide me with a timeline for your investigation and resolution. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX **Enclosures : ** 1. Copy of Credit Report 2. Proof of Account Closure

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this complaint because my credit report contains inaccurate and potentially unlawful entries, which violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The issues I am experiencing are outlined below : 1. Duplicate Reporting of the Same Debt Under 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), creditors and collection agencies are prohibited from furnishing inaccurate or misleading information to credit bureaus. My credit report shows the same debt reported multiple times by different entities : Original Lender : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX Investments Both accounts reflect the same original balance of {$990.00}, the same current balance of {$990.00}, and the same date assigned ( XX/XX/year> ). This duplicative reporting is misleading, unfairly impacts my credit score, and violates the FCRA requirement for accuracy in credit reporting. 

2. Incomplete or Missing Information Under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy and completeness of information. However, XXXX of the entries is missing key details ( e.g., the " Agency Name '' is blank for XXXX account ). This lack of information prevents me from understanding who owns the debt and whether it is being reported correctly. 

3. Failure to Update Information Under 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 2 ), furnishers are required to update information to ensure accuracy. If this debt has been sold or reassigned, the original creditor ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) should no longer report it. However, both entities are reporting the debt, suggesting the information is not being updated. 

4. Misrepresentation of Debt Responsibility If the debt has been transferred or sold to a collection agency, it is misleading for both the original creditor and the new collection agency to report the debt simultaneously. This violates the FCRA, as it creates confusion regarding the debt 's true ownership and status.

I am writing to express my serious concern regarding the lack of resolution for my previous dispute about unauthorized inquiries on my credit report, which I submitted on XX/XX/XXXX. According to my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ), I demand an immediate resolution. 
Unauthorized Inquiries in Question : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) requires a prompt investigation of disputed information. I submitted my dispute and have yet to receive an adequate resolution.

Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) grants me the right to access all information in my file, including the results of your investigation. To date, I have not received the required information.

Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. These inquiries were made without my consent and do not meet any permissible purpose under this section.

Immediate Request : I demand immediate action to resolve this dispute. Specifically, I request the following : Thorough Reinvestigation : Conduct a thorough reinvestigation of the unauthorized inquiries.

Removal of Unauthorized Inquiries : Remove any inquiries found to be unauthorized from my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the inaccurate reporting of the following charge-off entries on my credit report XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX These entries are inaccurate and violate my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). I demand an immediate investigation and correction of these inaccuracies to ensure compliance with federal law. 

Violations of Federal Law 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of any disputed information within 30 days. Failure to do so is a violation of federal law.

15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) : Mandates that credit reporting agencies maintain reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. The reporting of these inaccurate charge-offs violates this provision. 



2. Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : 15 U.S. Code 1692g : Debt collectors must validate any debt upon request. If a charge-off can not be validated, it is unlawful for the creditor or debt collector to continue reporting the account.

3. Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : 15 U.S. Code 1635 : Creditors must provide accurate and fair disclosures related to the terms and validity of debts. Reporting charge-offs without proper documentation may constitute a violation of this statute.

Damages and Remedies If these inaccuracies are not corrected promptly, I reserve the right to pursue legal remedies under the FCRA and FDCPA, including : Statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation. 

Actual damages caused by these inaccuracies, such as increased interest rates, credit denials, or emotional distress. 

Punitive damages for willful noncompliance with federal statutes. 

Recovery of legal fees and associated costs. 


Action Requested I demand the following actions : 1. Conduct a thorough investigation of these accounts to verify their accuracy.

2. Remove the inaccurate charge-off entries from my credit report immediately.

3. Provide a written statement confirming the removal or correction of these entries within 30 days, as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). 



Next Steps Failure to comply with these demands will leave me no choice but to file complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and other relevant regulatory bodies. Additionally, I will consult legal counsel to pursue remedies under federal law for the harm caused by these inaccuracies. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

I am writing to express my serious concern regarding the lack of resolution for my previous dispute about unauthorized inquiries on my credit report, which I submitted on 11/16/2024. According to my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ), I demand an immediate resolution.

Unauthorized Inquiries in Question : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) requires a prompt investigation of disputed information. I submitted my dispute and have yet to receive an adequate resolution.

Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) grants me the right to access all information in my file, including the results of your investigation. To date, I have not received the required information.

Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. These inquiries were made without my consent and do not meet any permissible purpose under this section.

Immediate Request : I demand immediate action to resolve this dispute. Specifically, I request the following : Thorough Reinvestigation : Conduct a thorough reinvestigation of the unauthorized inquiries.

Removal of Unauthorized Inquiries : Remove any inquiries found to be unauthorized from my credit report.

Updated Credit Report : Provide me with an updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes.

Enclosed are copies of my previous dispute letter and a copy of my identification for verification purposes.

I am sending to bring to your attention the presence of inaccurate information on my credit report with your agency. The incorrect details are as follows : XXXX - XXXX, XXXX XXXX  XXXX - XXXX, XXXX - XXXX, INQUIRY - XX/XX/XXXX, INQUIRY - XX/XX/XXXX XXXX  - XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX  - XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX XXXX  - XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX  - XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX  - XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX  - XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX  - XX/XX/XXXX XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX XXXX  - XX/XX/XXXX The aforementioned inaccuracies are materially affecting my creditworthiness and causing harm to my financial well-being. I believe it is crucial to rectify these errors promptly. 

I have conducted a thorough review of my financial records and can provide supporting evidence to substantiate my claims regarding the inaccuracies. Attached to this affidavit are copies of relevant documents that demonstrate the discrepancies, including but not limited to : Bank statements, payment receipts, and correspondence with creditors I request that you undertake a complete and fair investigation into these matters and take appropriate action to remove the inaccurate information from my credit report. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), it is your responsibility to ensure the accuracy of the information you maintain and report. 

Furthermore, I request that you provide me with a written notification upon completion of your investigation, including details of the actions taken, any changes made to my credit report, and a revised copy of my credit report reflecting the accurate and updated information.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
To : Credit Reporting Agency Subject : Request for Removal of Unverifiable Account Dear Credit Reporting Department, I am writing to formally notify you regarding the outcome of a recent dispute I filed with XXXX regarding the account listed under the name " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. '' After the investigation was completed by XXXX on XX/XX/year>, the account was deleted from my XXXX credit report due to its unverifiability. 

As you are aware, according to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), all information reported to credit reporting agencies must be accurate, complete, and verifiable. Since XXXX has already determined that this account is unverifiable and deleted it from my credit file, I request that you take the necessary steps to update your records and remove the same account from your reporting system. 

The FCRA, specifically Section 1681i, states that if a disputed item can not be verified, it must be removed from the consumers credit report. Since XXXX has verified that this account is unverifiable and removed it from my XXXX report, the same must apply to your agency. 

Please update my credit report accordingly and ensure the removal of the account within 30 days of receipt of this letter. If this account is not deleted from your records within 30 days, I will consider all available legal remedies, including filing a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and pursuing legal action for violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Under the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccurate information, and I am entitled to have that information corrected or removed if it can not be verified. Furthermore, under Section 1681s-2 ( b ) of the FCRA, failure to correct or remove unverifiable information can subject you to legal penalties, including the right to sue for damages.

Please treat this matter with the urgency it deserves and confirm in writing that this account has been removed from your records. I expect prompt action within the 30-day window provided by law. 

If you need further documentation or information, please do not hesitate to contact me directly. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to express my extreme dissatisfaction and concern regarding the unresolved status of my previous dispute about unauthorized inquiries on my credit report, which I submitted on [ XX/XX/year> ] and followed up on [ XX/XX/year> ]. This is my final attempt to resolve this matter amicably. I demand an immediate resolution in accordance with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ). 
Unauthorized Inquiries in Question XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) requires an immediate investigation of disputed information. It has been more than 30 days since my initial dispute, and I have yet to receive an adequate resolution, which is unacceptable.

Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) entitles me to access all information in my file, including the results of your investigation. To date, I have not received the required information, which constitutes a violation of my rights.

Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. These inquiries were made without my consent and do not meet any permissible purpose under this section, representing a serious infraction. 
Immediate Action Required I demand immediate action to resolve this dispute. Specifically, I request the following : 1. Thorough and Immediate Reinvestigation : Conduct a complete and urgent reinvestigation of the unauthorized inquiries.

2. Immediate Removal of Unauthorized Inquiries : Remove any inquiries found to be unauthorized from my credit report without delay.

3. Updated Credit Report : Provide me with an updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes immediately.

4. Detailed and Documented Notification : Inform me in detail of the steps taken and the results of your investigation within 15 days of receipt of this letter. Include documentation supporting your actions. 
Warning of Legal Action If I do not receive a satisfactory resolution within the specified timeframe, I will escalate this issue to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and proceed with legal action to protect my rights as a consumer. I will not hesitate to seek compensation for any damages resulting from your failure to adequately resolve this matter. 
I expect your immediate response and resolution to this issue.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern, This letter is a formal complaint that you are reporting inaccurate and incomplete credit information on my Experian Credit report.

15 USC 1681e ( b ) Compliance and Procedures ( b ) ACCURACY OF REPORT Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 

Otherwise, anyone paying for your services could fax, mail or email in a fraudulent account. 

I demand to see verifiable proof ( i.e. : an original consumer contract with my signature on it ) that you have on file for the account listed below. Or a Certification from the creditors that certified the accuracy and completeness of the information/account. 

Your failure to positively verify these accounts has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Under the FCRA, unverifiable accounts must be DELETED and if you are unable to provide me a copy of verifiable proof, you must DELETE the account listed below. 

I demand that the following account be validated and DELETED immediately : XXXX. Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Dated Listed : XXXX XXXX, 2024

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, La XXXX XX/XX/2024 To : Whom it May Concern Subject : Request for Removal of Unverifiable Account Dear Credit Reporting Department, I am writing to formally request the removal of an account from my credit report as reported by [ XXXX, Experian, or XXXX ]. This request is based on the recent deletion of an account by XXXX, XXXX of the XXXX major credit reporting agencies. I recently disputed a charge-o for { Charge off amount goes here } from { Creditor Goes here/ or company account was sold too }, listed on my XXXX report, and following a thorough investigation, XXXX has completely removed this unverifiable debt from my report as of XX/XX/2024. 
According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ), all consumer reporting agencies must ensure that information in consumer reports is accurate, fair, and verifiable. 
Since XXXX has removed this account after its verification process, I request that you do the same and remove this unverifiable account from my credit report. 
Supporting Consumer Laws : FCRA Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) requires that inaccurate or unverifiable information must be deleted from a consumer 's credit file. I am exercising my right to ensure that my credit report remains fair, accurate, and free of unverifiable information. Since XXXX has deemed this account unverifiable and removed it, you must take similar action. 
Additionally, under FCRA Section 623 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ), information suppliers must report only complete and accurate information. With XXXX having deemed this information unverifiable, I urge you to align its records accordingly. 
Please provide confirmation of this removal within XXXX days of receipt of this request. If the account is not removed, I am prepared to pursue further actions, including filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and seeking legal action under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), including Section 616 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681n ), which allows consumers to seek legal recourse for willful non- compliance, and Section 617 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681o ) for negligent non-compliance. 
I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter, as it directly impacts my credit report 's integrity. Please notify me in writing once this deletion has been processed. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this request. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Request for Consumer Disclosure Under the FCRA Dear XXXX XXXX Pursuant to Section 609 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C . 1681g ), I am requesting a copy of my full consumer credit report. Under the FCRA, you are legally obligated to provide this report upon request from a consumer, free of charge if certain conditions are met.

Please include all information in your files at the time of this request, including but not limited to credit accounts, inquiries, and any public record information. Additionally, I request the names of all parties who have accessed my credit report within the past year for employment purposes and within the past two years for any other purpose. 

Enclosed are copies of my drivers license, Social Security card, and a recent bank statement to verify my identity and address. I expect to receive the requested information within the 15-day period as required by law. Thank you for your attention to this matter. Should you need any additional information, please do not hesitate to contact me. 

Sincerely, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Request for Consumer Disclosure Under the FCRA Dear XXXX , Pursuant to Section 609 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), I am formally requesting a copy of my complete consumer credit report. As stipulated by federal law, you are required to provide this information to consumers upon request. 

This request is for all credit and public record information maintained in my file, as well as a list of all entities that have accessed my credit report in the appropriate time frames. I am enclosing identification documents to confirm my identity and address. 

Please fulfill this request promptly and within the legally mandated timeframe. I appreciate your cooperation and look forward to receiving my report. 

Sincerely, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Request for Consumer Disclosure Under the FCRA Dear XXXX, This is a formal request for a copy of my consumer credit report under Section 609 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ). Please include all relevant details, such as credit account information, inquiries, and public record entries, and provide the names of all entities that have accessed my credit report within the permissible periods. I have attached verification documents to ensure prompt processing of my request. 

Thank you for complying with federal law and for your assistance in providing my report. 

Sincerely, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint Pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) I formally request that XXXX block the accounts, collections, and hard inquiries identified below from my credit file within XXXX business days as required by law. Written confirmation of this request should be sent to me. 

Background : I am a victim of identity theft and the XXXX data breach. My credit report contains unauthorized accounts that negatively impact my ability to obtain credit. 
Violations : The accounts and inquiries violate the following : -15 U.S.C. 1692e : False/Misleading Representations -15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Failure to Ensure Accuracy -15 U.S.C. 1681i : Failure to Investigate Disputes -15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) : Reporting Obsolete Information Accounts for Removal : Experian, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
