Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
This CFPB complaint has been filed to request, pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), that you, the Equifax credit reporting agency , block all fraudulent and inaccurate information appearing on my consumer credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud. I demand that this fraudulent information be blocked within four ( 4 ) business days of your receipt of this complaint as required by law. 

The fraudulent, inaccurate, and false information on my credit report includes the following accounts : XXXX XXXX XXXX - Opened on XX/XX/XXXX, under account number XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX - XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, under account number XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) - Opened on XX/XX/XXXX, under account number XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX - XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, under account number XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX - XXXX account opened on XX/XX/XXXX, under account number XXXX, with an unpaid balance of {$16000.00}. 
US Department of Education XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) - Collection account opened on XX/XX/XXXX, under account number XXXX, with an unpaid balance of {$5700.00}. 
XXXX XXXX - XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, under account number XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX - Opened on XX/XX/XXXX, under account number XXXX 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, under account number XXXX. 
XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, under account number XXXX. 
Additionally, fraudulent collections and hard inquiries have resulted from these accounts, including : A collections account opened at XXXX XXXX XXXX for {$16000.00}. 
A collections account opened at US Department of Education for {$5700.00}. 
Other hard inquiries related to these accounts, fraudulently initiated using my stolen personal information. 
I do not recognize any of these accounts, collections, or hard inquiries as reported. These items were not opened, made, or authorized by me and are the result of identity theft and fraud. 

Supporting Evidence : To support my complaint, I have attached the following documentation : FTC Identity Theft Affidavit ( Criminal Complaint # [ PRIVATE CASE NUMBER ] ) substantiating my claim of identity theft and fraud. 
A copy of my consumer credit report with fraudulent accounts, collections, and hard inquiries highlighted. 
A detailed list of fraudulent hard inquiries. 
Copies of my government-issued identification and proof of residence to verify my identity. 
Explanation of Harm : These fraudulent accounts and collections have resulted in significant harm to my credit report, including derogatory marks, reduced credit scores, and additional hard inquiries. These inaccuracies are negatively affecting my financial opportunities and creditworthiness. Under FCRA 605B, it is your legal obligation to block these fraudulent accounts, collections, and inquiries from my credit file within four ( 4 ) business days of receiving this complaint. 

Demand for Relief : I respectfully request that Equifax take the following actions : Block all fraudulent accounts, collections, and hard inquiries identified in this complaint from my consumer credit file within four ( 4 ) business days of receiving this complaint, as required under FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ). 
Provide written confirmation of the removal of these fraudulent items from my consumer credit file. 
Cease and desist all attempts to verify these fraudulent accounts with creditors without notifying me first and ensuring compliance with all applicable laws. 
If Equifax decides to verify these fraudulent items, this action would violate my rights under FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, and potentially subject the agency to penalties under both the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) for willful negligence and further harm. I expect strict compliance with FCRA 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) and all other relevant statutes. 

Failure to comply with my request may result in legal action to enforce my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, and the Uniform Commercial Code. 

Legal Notice : Please send written confirmation of the actions taken in response to this complaint to my email at XXXX. This written confirmation must include the date and details of all fraudulent items removed from my credit file. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently reviewed my credit profile and noticed inaccuracies and/or incomplete information, and accounts that are Un-Verified. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to promptly DELETE all information that is inaccurate, incomplete, or which can not be verified. 

It is also my understanding that Under the FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i, every single one even each any or all of the unproven, non-compliant, incomplete, untrue, incorrect, and or unverified aspects of any alleged derogatory accounts must be promptly negated in its entirety or the alleged accounts are to be completely deleted.

She sent my payment and a note back to me to call Regions customer service. I called the number on the form for Regions Mortgage customer service. The customer service representative stated that he could not take my payment. I asked him what is the total amount to pay. He stated that it was {$3000.00}. I told him that I would write a check for that amount. The customer service representative told me that he wasn't sure if that is the total amount. 
He advised that they would mail me the total amount and in the meantime, did I want to apply for a hardship. I applied for the hardship over the phone. 
I received the total reinstatement amount from an Attorney in XXXX on behalf of Regions. I would have paid that amount but I disputed a certain portion and The Attorney accelerated foreclosure with a sale date without a modification application being approved and/ or allowing due diligence to answer my dispute about the amount.

Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint regarding my ongoing issues with identity theft and data breaches that have resulted in unauthorized transactions on my bank account and credit cards. 

As a victim of identity theft, I have experienced fraudulent charges that have severely impacted my financial situation. In XX/XX/year>, I submitted fraud claims to Capital One for both my bank account and credit card accounts. However, to date, my accounts have not been credited for the fraudulent charges, which is beyond the legal time frame for resolving such issues as outlined in the Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) and the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ). 

Capital One customer service representatives have informed me that I must wait up to 90 days for the completion of their investigation before any credits can be released. This extended delay is causing significant financial distress, as the inaccurate balances on my accounts continue to create additional problems for me, affecting my ability to access funds and manage my finances responsibly. 

According to Section 1693g of the EFTA, consumers are entitled to prompt investigation and resolution of unauthorized electronic fund transfers. Furthermore, the FCBA provides consumers with rights regarding the investigation of billing errors. The lack of timely action on my claims not only violates my rights as a consumer but also hinders my ability to resolve the detrimental effects of identity theft. 

I request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) investigate this matter and assist in ensuring that Capital One adheres to the requirements set forth by federal law. I appreciate your attention to my complaint and look forward to your prompt response.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
To : Credit Reporting Agency Subject : Request for Removal of Unverifiable Account Dear Credit Reporting Department, I am writing to formally notify you regarding the outcome of a recent dispute I filed with XXXX regarding the account listed under the name " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. '' After the investigation was completed by XXXX on XX/XX/year>, the account was deleted from my XXXX credit report due to its unverifiability. 

As you are aware, according to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), all information reported to credit reporting agencies must be accurate, complete, and verifiable. Since XXXX has already determined that this account is unverifiable and deleted it from my credit file, I request that you take the necessary steps to update your records and remove the same account from your reporting system. 

The FCRA, specifically Section 1681i, states that if a disputed item can not be verified, it must be removed from the consumers credit report. Since XXXX has verified that this account is unverifiable and removed it from my XXXX report, the same must apply to your agency. 

Please update my credit report accordingly and ensure the removal of the account within XXXX days of receipt of this letter. If this account is not deleted from your records within XXXX  days, I will consider all available legal remedies, including filing a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and pursuing legal action for violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Under the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccurate information, and I am entitled to have that information corrected or removed if it can not be verified. Furthermore, under Section 1681s-2 ( b ) of the FCRA, failure to correct or remove unverifiable information can subject you to legal penalties, including the right to sue for damages. 

Please treat this matter with the urgency it deserves and confirm in writing that this account has been removed from your records. I expect prompt action within the XXXX window provided by law. 

If you need further documentation or information, please do not hesitate to contact me directly. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to formally request an investigation into the procedures employed by the major credit reporting agenciesTransUnion, Equifax, and Experianregarding the accuracy of information reported on my credit file. I am concerned about certain inaccuracies that I have identified and the subsequent failure of these agencies to provide adequate responses and documentation, which I believe constitutes a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Background Recently, I submitted complaints to XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX regarding incorrect information reported on my credit reports. Despite my efforts to address these inaccuracies, I have not received satisfactory responses or valid proof of the claims made by these agencies. Most importantly, I have repeatedly requested to review the " Procedures of Accuracy '' that these agencies claim to use to verify the information in my reports. Thus far, I have not received any meaningful information or documentation in response to my requests. 

Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) The FCRA outlines specific responsibilities for credit reporting agencies, including the requirement to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. Below are specific violations of the FCRA that I believe warrant your investigation : 1. Section 607 ( b ) - Reasonable Procedures : Credit reporting agencies are required to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. I have doubts that XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX have adhered to this requirement in my case, as the inaccuracies I reported have not been corrected nor explained. 

2. Section 611 - Procedure in Case of Disputed Accuracy : Upon receiving my dispute, these agencies are mandated to conduct a reasonable investigation of my claims within 30 days. I submitted my dispute to all three agencies, but they have failed to provide the required investigation results or documentation supporting the accuracy of the reported information. Their lack of response is a clear violation of this section. 

XXXX. Failure to Validate Debts : When I identified the inaccuracies, I requested that the agencies provide validation of the debts and the procedures they used to verify the informations accuracy. Under the FCRA, they are obligated to provide this information and their failure to do so represents another violation of my consumer rights. 

4. Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) - Duty of Furnishers of Information : Any entity that provides information to consumer reporting agencies must ensure the accuracy of that information. If the information provided is found to be inaccurate, the furnishers have a duty to correct it. I am concerned that the agencies are not holding these furnishers accountable for the inaccurate reporting.

5. Lack of Adequate Consumer Responses : The agencies have not provided timely or useful responses to my inquiries, which I believe underlines a broader failure to protect consumer rights as mandated by the FCRA. 

Request for Action Given the collective issues I have faced, I respectfully ask the CFPB to conduct a thorough investigation into the practices of XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX regarding how they handle inaccuracies and disputes. Furthermore, I urge your office to compel these agencies to provide their " Procedures of Accuracy '' and ensure they are compliant with the FCRA requirements.

As a consumer, I have the right to accurate credit reporting, and the current situation jeopardizes my financial health and fundamental rights. I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to your timely response. 
I am writing to formally submit a complaint against XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX for multiple violations of federal laws governing credit reporting and consumer privacy. Specifically, I believe these credit reporting agencies have violated the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681a ( i ) and 1681i, the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ), 15 U.S.C. 6801-6805, the Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ), 15 U.S.C. 1666b, and the Privacy Act of 1974, 5 U.S.C. 552a. 

1. Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies maintain accurate and complete information in consumer reports. Section 15 U.S.C. 1681i places a requirement on these agencies to conduct a reasonable investigation when a dispute is raised by a consumer. Despite my numerous attempts to dispute inaccurate information on my credit reports, I have received no effective responses or resolutions. The inaccurate entries include : - [ Specify inaccuracies e.g., incorrect account balances, erroneous public records, etc. ] - [ Provide details on unauthorized inquiries dated, as applicable ] These inaccuracies jeopardize the integrity of my credit report and have impacted my creditworthiness adversely. 

2. Violations of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) : The GLBA, specifically 15 U.S.C. 6801-6805, mandates that financial institutions protect consumer privacy. I have discovered unauthorized inquiries on my credit report for which I did not provide consent. This represents a clear violation of my right to control access to my personal financial information.

3. Violations of the Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) : I believe the actions of these credit bureaus also infringe upon my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1666b, as they have failed to provide proper procedures for disputing billing errors. My written requests and disputes have gone unanswered, violating my rights under this act.

4. Violations of the Privacy Act of 1974 : Under the Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. 552a, I have the right to know what personal information is being collected about me and to whom it is being disclosed. I have been unsuccessful in obtaining this information, especially concerning unauthorized inquiries. 

5. Section 1681a ( 2 ) ( I ) : Section 15 U.S.C. 1681a ( 2 ) ( I ) concerns the transactions and experiences commonly used in credit reports. The inaccuracies reported suggest a failure in this area, further undermining my trust in the credit reporting process. 

I expect these agencies to adhere strictly to the provisions of the FCRA and other relevant laws, ensuring they provide accurate, complete, and timely information to consumers. I ask the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to investigate these matters thoroughly and hold these credit bureaus accountable for their actions. 

Thank you for your attention to this significant issue. I look forward to your prompt action in resolving my complaints and restoring the accuracy and integrity of my credit reports.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the incorrect reporting of late payments on my credit file for the following accounts : XXXX. XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( Late Pay ) XXXX. XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( Late Pay ) These late payment notations are inaccurate and violate multiple provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), and relevant regulations. I am requesting an immediate investigation and the removal of these incorrect entries to ensure compliance with federal law. 

Violations of Federal Law 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 15 U.S. Code 1681a ( 2 ) ( xi ) : Credit reporting agencies and furnishers must ensure that all information included in a consumers credit file is accurate and verifiable. Reporting unverifiable or inaccurate late payments breaches this standard.

15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 : Furnishers of information are legally required to report accurate data and promptly correct errors when notified.

2. Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : 15 U.S. Code 1666 ( b ) : Billing errors, including misreported late payments, must be thoroughly investigated and resolved by creditors. Failure to comply with this requirement constitutes a direct violation of federal law.

3. Regulations Implementing TILA : 12 CFR 1026.13 : This regulation outlines the obligations of creditors to investigate and resolve billing disputes, including errors in reporting late payments. Noncompliance with this regulation is subject to penalties. 




Damages and Remedies If these inaccuracies are not corrected promptly, I reserve the right to seek remedies under the following provisions : Statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation under FCRA ( 15 U.S. Code 1681n and 1681o ).

Actual damages resulting from the inaccuracies, including higher interest rates, credit denials, and emotional distress.

Punitive damages for willful noncompliance.

Recovery of legal fees and associated costs related to pursuing this matter.

Action Requested I am requesting that : 1. A comprehensive investigation be conducted for the accounts listed above in compliance with FCRA and TILA.

2. All inaccurate late payment entries be promptly removed from my credit report.

3. A written confirmation of the resolution be sent to me within 30 days, as required by 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). 



Next Steps I trust that your team will handle this matter with the seriousness it deserves and resolve it promptly. If this issue is not corrected, I will be compelled to file complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and other relevant regulatory agencies. Additionally, I will consult legal counsel to pursue remedies under the law for the harm caused by these inaccuracies. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative: In XXXX of XXXX, my student loan was sold to Aidvantage. I set up automatic payments. My payment was for {$150.00}. That first payment said I was delinquent and owed an additional {$52.00}. When I contacted the company I was told multiple different things including, I need to pay the delinquent amount, they dont know why my accounts were not paid and that this was an oversight that would have fixed itself if I left it alone. Essentially, the company has paid XXXX out of XXXX of my accounts. This continued to show delinquency through XXXX when I called them again and contacted the Federal Department of Education and filed a formal complaint. In XXXX, Aidvantage acknowledged I overplayed the account and would remedy past payments to reflect accurate payments of all XXXX loans. They also said due to overpayment they would modify my payments for the next XXXX payments ( XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX would be {$52.00} and XX/XX/XXXX would be {$18.00} ). On XXXX XXXX, I checked my bank account and saw a pending transaction from Aidvantage for {$110.00}, I double checked my account on Aidvantage which stated my payment of {$52.00} was pending, however, the next day the transaction hit my account at {$110.00} and I also received a new notice from Aidvantage that XXXX and XXXX payments would now be {$110.00}, with no prior statement to change for XXXX. When I contacted Aidvantage about illegally taking more than double the payment from my account, they only responded that they were legally in their right. With this payment I also received a notice that despite my overpayment of more than double what my statement was, I was also delinquent again on my account. I have tried numerous times in XXXX and XXXX to contact Aidvantage to rectify the problem and they will not respond to my requests. On XXXX XXXX I paid the next payment of {$110.00} and today, XX/XX/XXXX, I received another delinquency notice of {$52.00}. I am tired of being told I am delinquent each month, having failure to have Aidvantage respond to each request and Aidvantage failing to properly pay my loans from my automatic payments.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute certain entries on my credit report. I do not recognize the listed accounts or their current status as reported. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i, I am entitled to dispute inaccurate or incomplete information on my credit report. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), creditors and credit reporting agencies are required to ensure that the information provided to them is accurate and complete.

The accounts I dispute are as follows : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Balance : {$4600.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Balance : {$750.00} XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Number : XXXX Balance : {$3700.00} XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Balance : {$1000.00} I hereby state that I do not recognize any of these accounts or the amounts reported as being owed. I have never opened these accounts, nor do I acknowledge any liability for these charges. These accounts may be the result of identity theft or clerical errors.

Furthermore, in accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692 ( g ), I request that you provide proper verification of these debts, including the name of the creditor and the detailed history of the alleged debts. I reserve my right to dispute these debts further should proper validation not be provided.

Please investigate these matters and, in accordance with the FCRA, remove or correct any inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information on my credit report. I request that you provide me with the results of your investigation, as well as a copy of the corrected credit report upon completion.

If any of these accounts were reported in error, I also request that you remove the negative entries and notify me in writing of the actions taken. If verification can not be provided, I expect these items to be permanently deleted from my credit report in accordance with the FCRA.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your confirmation of the dispute resolution.

I am writing to formally dispute the late payment history entry on my credit report. These entries constitute a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). 

List of Companies and Unauthorized Reporting which are not accurate and must be removed : >XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX The above ARE INACCUTATE and Specifically violates my rights with Unlawful Furnishing of Consumer Reports Without Authorization & Improper Late Payment Designation : Violation of FCRA Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports : According to 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ), a consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report only with the consumers explicit written instructions.

I did not authorize and I request you have the companies send verification and all the documentation they claim to have received from me and the Verification steps the conducted to confirm it was me and had EXPLICIT authorization they received from me Improper Late Payment Designation : Under 15 U.S.C. 1666b, creditors must adopt reasonable procedures to ensure statements are delivered at least 21 days before the payment due date. If this procedure was not followed, the late payment designation is invalid.

I did not receive such documentation AND i did not authorize. I request you have the companies send verification and all the documentation they claim to have received from me and the Verification steps the conducted to confirm it was me and had EXPL
ICIT authorization they received from me.

According to Section 604 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681b ), creditors may only access a consumers credit report with a permissible purpose, which requires explicit consent. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
Equifax is unaware of proper credit reporting and the FTC and CFPB relationship. 

According to proper procedure, fraudulent credit reporting issues are handled through the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), not the FTC. 
XXXX website directs consumers to file reports via the CFPB through the FTC Fraud Report system.

However EQIFAX does't know this and I was informed that my file did not include an FTC report . Therefore, my disputes include reports made through the CFPB, and I have attached the necessary documentation to support my claim. 

I urge CFPB to educate Equifax to update your internal policies to align with changes adopted by the major credit bureaus. This ensures your representatives, who are supposed to assist customers, are properly informed and do not provide inaccurate or misleading guidance.

Miscommunication such as this only adds to the frustration caused by incorrect credit reporting and may result in legitimate disputes being improperly handled.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XX/XX/year> Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) Dear Equifax Team, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy of certain information in my consumer file, as provided under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). 

The details of the disputed information are as follows : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I noticed my credit reports are reflecting inaccurate information. One report date of the last activity is missing, this fact is considered inaccurate information that has been reported like this for over 3 years. This account needs to be deleted from my credit report effective immediately. 

I request a free reinvestigation of this information, as required by law. I believe this information is inaccurate for the following reasons : Date of last activity should be the same. Stop sending stall letters stating you can't locate a credit file, and that the information is erroneous. 

As mandated, I expect the reinvestigation to be completed within the 30-day period from the date you receive this letter. If the disputed information is found to be inaccurate, I request that it be deleted from my file, and that I receive a corrected copy of my credit report reflecting these changes. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely,

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 16815-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this complaint because my credit report contains inaccurate and potentially unlawful entries, which violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The issues I am experiencing are outlined below : 1. Duplicate Reporting of the Same Debt Under 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), creditors and collection agencies are prohibited from furnishing inaccurate or misleading information to credit bureaus. My credit report shows the same debt reported multiple times by different entities : Original Lender : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX Investments Both accounts reflect the same original balance of {$990.00}, the same current balance of {$990.00}, and the same date assigned ( XX/XX/year> ). This duplicative reporting is misleading, unfairly impacts my credit score, and violates the FCRA requirement for accuracy in credit reporting. 

2. Incomplete or Missing Information Under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy and completeness of information. However, XXXX of the entries is missing key details ( e.g., the " Agency Name '' is blank for one account ). This lack of information prevents me from understanding who owns the debt and whether it is being reported correctly. 

3. Failure to Update Information Under 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 2 ), furnishers are required to update information to ensure accuracy. If this debt has been sold or reassigned, the original creditor ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) should no longer report it. However, both entities are reporting the debt, suggesting the information is not being updated. 

4. Misrepresentation of Debt Responsibility If the debt has been transferred or sold to a collection agency, it is misleading for both the original creditor and the new collection agency to report the debt simultaneously. This violates the FCRA, as it creates confusion regarding the debt 's true ownership and status.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate and unauthorized information appearing on my Equifax credit report. These accounts were added due to a data breach and are not authorized or representative of my financial history. I request immediate investigation and removal of the following accounts from my credit report : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Pursuant to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I assert the following rights and request specific actions to address this issue : Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( FCRA 611 ) : I request that the disputed information be investigated and verified as accurate. If the disputed accounts can not be verified, they must be deleted from my credit report.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ( FCRA 607 ) : Equifax is obligated to ensure maximum possible accuracy in reporting my credit information. These accounts are inaccurate and result from identity theft or misreporting tied to the referenced data breach.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( FCRA 605A ( b ) ) : I request that these fraudulent items be removed as they stem from a breach of my personal data.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681g ( FCRA 609 ) : I request access to all documentation, records, and communications related to the inclusion of these accounts on my credit report.

Given the widespread data breaches that have affected financial institutions and compromised consumers ' sensitive information, I believe these accounts may have been fraudulently opened or erroneously reported. I demand that these accounts be thoroughly investigated in compliance with FCRA requirements and deleted from my credit report if found unverifiable or inaccurate.

Additionally, under the Federal Trade Commission Act ( 15 U.S.C. 45 ), it is illegal for businesses to engage in unfair or deceptive practices. Reporting inaccurate or fraudulent accounts on my credit report due to negligence in protecting consumer data constitutes a violation of this statute.

I have attached all relevant documents to support this dispute, including copies of my Equifax credit report highlighting the disputed accounts.

Please confirm receipt of this dispute and keep me informed about the progress of the investigation. If Equifax does not resolve this issue promptly, I reserve the right to pursue additional actions to ensure compliance with FCRA regulations.

List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681 XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX XXXX I looked at my XXXX credit report on XXXX XXXX and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are supposed to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are supposed to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Reporting and Request for 1099-C Documentation To Whom It May Concern, I am disputing the accuracy of an account listed on my credit report under 15 USC 1681s-2 , which mandates the reporting of accurate and verifiable information. 

The account in question is as follows : XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  The balance currently being reported is inaccurate and potentially unlawful. XXXX XXXX v. XXXX XXXX XXXX, the issuance of a 1099-C form by a creditor indicates the occurrence of an identifiable event of debt cancellation. Under IRS regulations, Event Code 7 defines such an event as a discharge of indebtedness due to the creditors policy decision to cease collection activity and cancel the debt.

If a 1099-C form has been issued for this account, the debt has been canceled, and reporting a balance is inaccurate and misleading. I am requesting the following : Verification of the Account Balance : Provide evidence demonstrating that the balance is accurate and collectible.

Provision of the 1099-C Form : If issued, provide a copy to verify the identifiable event.

Immediate Deletion of the Account : If the debt was discharged under Event Code 7 or can not be verified, you are required to delete this negative information under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 

Attached, you will find [ list of supporting documents ]. Please investigate this matter within the legally required 30-day timeframe. Failure to respond appropriately will result in further action. 

Thank you for your prompt attention. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX  XX/XX/XXXX XXXX - XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Auto ) - XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate reporting of a late payment on my credit report. The account in question, under the name XXXX XXXX, is erroneously listed as having a late payment for XXXX. This is incorrect, as the payment was made on time and in accordance with the accounts terms. 

Pursuant to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), it is the responsibility of consumer reporting agencies to ensure that all information reported is accurate and complete. The reporting of a late payment on this account is neither. This account has never been late, and the record must reflect that fact. 

I have enclosed a copy of my credit report highlighting the disputed item. I demand that you investigate this matter thoroughly, correct this inaccuracy, and delete the erroneous late payment from my record without delay. 

Please provide written confirmation of the results of your investigation and any corrective action taken.

I submitted a CFPB Complaint on XX/XX/year> Complaint ID XXXX ( open ), and another complaint on XX/XX/year> Complaint ID XXXX ( open ). This shows Equifax refusal to investigate and respond with factual information requested.

Legal Basis Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( a ) : Fraudulent accounts must be blocked within four business days upon receiving notice of identity theft.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Unable to get your credit report or credit score
Sub-issue: Other problem getting your report or credit score
Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX Equifax was contacted due to problems with accessing my.equifax login. Upon initial attempts to access site I was able to gain access and was currently trying to review the information I was looking for when I was rerouted out of the site back to the login screen. I attempted to login again with the same credentials and received an error message with instructions to call a number and I called. After holding I was connected with a woman who ask if I was using a XXXX XXXX to login, I answered yes. She wanted me to use XXXX XXXX, so I switched phones to my android phone and proceeded with the XXXX XXXX browser and attempted to login and received the same error message. She wanted my email and to send me a reset link to reset my password for the equifax account. I had already reset my password for the account before accessing the account previously when I was kicked off of it. During the time I was in the account previously however I had time to dispute one thing in the equifax report of a credit card I didn't recognize. It shows open but under the other part it said terminated. I don't know what that means for a credit card, but it had no payment info, no balance on it and no information historically. As soon as i was done with the dispute and returned back to the report and began to scroll down it flashed some then it kicked me out of the program. I have not been able to access it since. While on the phone with equifax I decided to go ahead and ask about the credit card that I was trying to check on originally that was not showing on my credit report I had been instructed to contact the credit bureaus about myself by the credit card company. That is when she told me that she had no information on the credit card and I should call the company back and tell them to report it. From what I have read the credit bureaus are supposed to investigate these things when it is reported to them by a certain amount of time and respond to the consumer of the findings in writing. Either way, I am not the secretary for XXXX XXXX or equifax, nor am I there for them to waste my time or my money in interest rates and phone calls. I have spent XXXX hours and XXXX minutes on this just this afternoon alone. I have had a credit card from XXXX XXXX since XX/XX/XXXX that has never had a late payment, and I just activated my replacement XXXX XXXX XXXX  today for the expiring titanium XXXX XXXX I received back then. I feel I have been more than patient and polite about this situation. My patients however and southern manners are wearing thin. Quite thin. Not once has my credit card ever been reported to any of the credit bureaus yet. I have documentation in text and email from XXXX XXXX stating XX/XX/XXXX that this would be corrected and sent to the XXXX agencies. Today I was told to contact the agencies myself and tell them to update my credit report because they had sent my account information to the bureaus but it just has not been updated. If I do not pay my bill they would report me. This is clearly something that should be punished. Both to the credit bureaus and to the credit card companies. It affects people 's money and credit worthiness. This is my only credit card for a reason. I do not want more credit cards as I do not need what I can not pay for at the time of purchase in my opinion. I prefer not to spend money frivolous and I should not be punished for that.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to express my extreme dissatisfaction and concern regarding the unresolved status of my previous dispute about unauthorized inquiries on my credit report, which I submitted on [ XX/XX/year> ] and followed up on [ XX/XX/year> ]. This is my final attempt to resolve this matter amicably. I demand an immediate resolution in accordance with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ). 
Unauthorized Inquiries in Question XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) requires an immediate investigation of disputed information. It has been more than 30 days since my initial dispute, and I have yet to receive an adequate resolution, which is unacceptable. 
Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) entitles me to access all information in my file, including the results of your investigation. To date, I have not received the required information, which constitutes a violation of my rights.

Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. These inquiries were made without my consent and do not meet any permissible purpose under this section, representing a serious infraction.

Immediate Action Required I demand immediate action to resolve this dispute. Specifically, I request the following : 1. Thorough and Immediate Reinvestigation : Conduct a complete and urgent reinvestigation of the unauthorized inquiries.

2. Immediate Removal of Unauthorized Inquiries : Remove any inquiries found to be unauthorized from my credit report without delay. 
XXXX. Updated Credit Report : Provide me with an updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes immediately. 
XXXX. Detailed and Documented Notification : Inform me in detail of the steps taken and the results of your investigation within 15 days of receipt of this letter. Include documentation supporting your actions. 
Warning of Legal Action If I do not receive a satisfactory resolution within the specified timeframe, I will escalate this issue to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and proceed with legal action to protect my rights as a consumer. I will not hesitate to seek compensation for any damages resulting from your failure to adequately resolve this matter. 
I expect your immediate response and resolution to this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to express my serious concern regarding the lack of resolution for my previous dispute about unauthorized inquiries on my credit report, which I submitted on XX/XX/XXXX. According to my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ), I demand an immediate resolution. 
Unauthorized Inquiries in Question : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) requires a prompt investigation of disputed information. I submitted my dispute and have yet to receive an adequate resolution.

Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) grants me the right to access all information in my file, including the results of your investigation. To date, I have not received the required information.

Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. These inquiries were made without my consent and do not meet any permissible purpose under this section.

Immediate Request : I demand immediate action to resolve this dispute. Specifically, I request the following : Thorough Reinvestigation : Conduct a thorough reinvestigation of the unauthorized inquiries.

Removal of Unauthorized Inquiries : Remove any inquiries found to be unauthorized from my credit report.

Updated Credit Report : Provide me with an updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes. 

Enclosed are copies of my previous dispute letter and a copy of my identification for verification purposes.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to express my extreme dissatisfaction and concern regarding the unresolved status of my previous dispute about unauthorized inquiries on my credit report, which I submitted on [ XX/XX/year> ] and followed up on [ XX/XX/year> ]. This is my final attempt to resolve this matter amicably. I demand an immediate resolution in accordance with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ). 
Unauthorized Inquiries in Question XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) requires an immediate investigation of disputed information. It has been more than 30 days since my initial dispute, and I have yet to receive an adequate resolution, which is unacceptable. 
Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) entitles me to access all information in my file, including the results of your investigation. To date, I have not received the required information, which constitutes a violation of my rights.

Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. These inquiries were made without my consent and do not meet any permissible purpose under this section, representing a serious infraction.

Immediate Action Required I demand immediate action to resolve this dispute. Specifically, I request the following : 1. Thorough and Immediate Reinvestigation : Conduct a complete and urgent reinvestigation of the unauthorized inquiries.

2. Immediate Removal of Unauthorized Inquiries : Remove any inquiries found to be unauthorized from my credit report without delay.

3. Updated Credit Report : Provide me with an updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes immediately.

4. Detailed and Documented Notification : Inform me in detail of the steps taken and the results of your investigation within 15 days of receipt of this letter. Include documentation supporting your actions. 
Warning of Legal Action If I do not receive a satisfactory resolution within the specified timeframe, I will escalate this issue to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and proceed with legal action to protect my rights as a consumer. I will not hesitate to seek compensation for any damages resulting from your failure to adequately resolve this matter. 
I expect your immediate response and resolution to this issue.

According to 15 USC 6802 ( a ) A financial institution shall not disclose to other agency an account number similar form of access code or transaction of consumer. According to 15 USC 1681 ( b ) I did not give written consent no instructions for any inquiries to be allowed to report to EQUIFAX Credit Bureau. Please verify all in written letter. According to 18 USC 2028 ( a ) XXXX and EQUIFAX has committed Aggravated Identity Theft which is a crime according to 18 USC 2028. Please remove all inquiries on my credit Report with EQUIFAX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Late Payment Accounts Request for Investigation and Removal Dear Equifax, I am writing to formally dispute the reporting of late payments on the following accounts as listed on my credit report. These accounts contain inaccurate or unverifiable information and are impacting my credit score unfairly. 

Accounts in Dispute XXXX  XXXX ( Account # : XXXX ) XXXX  ( Account # : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( Account # : XXXX ) XXXX ( Account # XXXX XXXX ) Under 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( a ), furnishers of information are required to report accurate data and correct any inaccuracies. Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1666 ( b ), creditors must apply payments accurately and resolve disputes regarding billing errors promptly. Finally, 12 CFR 1026.13 provides protections for billing error resolution under Regulation Z of the Truth in Lending Act. 

I am requesting a thorough investigation into the accuracy of these late payments. If the information can not be verified, I request that these records be corrected or deleted from my credit report. 

Supporting Documents I have included the following documents to assist with your investigation : A copy of my identification Proof of current address Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), please complete this investigation and respond in writing within 30 days of receiving this letter. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
CFPB Complaint Statement : I am filing this complaint against Equifax for repeated violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) in their handling of my credit report. Despite being a documented victim of the Equifax data breach, Equifax continues to inaccurately report the following accounts on my credit report : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : This account is being reported as a charge-off repeatedly every month, falsely manipulating the payment history and extending its negative impact on my credit. This practice violates FCRA Section 605 ( c ) and Section 623, which require accurate reporting and prohibit altering the date of first delinquency ( DOFD ). 

XXXX XXXX : This account is being inaccurately reported with a XXXX balance but is listed as a charge-off/collection without proper payment history, creating a misleading and incomplete record. This also violates FCRA Section 623, as it fails to meet accuracy standards.

Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Balance : {$1500.00} Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Balance : {$0.00} Furthermore, Equifax has failed to investigate and correct these inaccuracies despite multiple disputes, violating FCRA Section 605B, which grants identity theft victims the right to have fraudulent accounts blocked or deleted within four business days. Equifax 's negligence in addressing these issues constitutes a direct violation of my rights under federal law.

I am requesting that the CFPB hold Equifax accountable for these violations, ensure these accounts are removed from my credit report, and take necessary enforcement actions to prevent further harm caused by their non-compliance.

Consumer complaint narrative: My name is XXXX XXXX and Social Security Number : XXXX, and Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXX, Contents of Complaint : This CFPB complaint has been filed to request pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) that you shall block information appearing on my consumer credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud within 4 business days of you receiving this complaint. This fraudulent, inaccurate, and false information consists of : Account Name : XXXX XXXX # XXXX - Opened on XX/XX/XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX - Opened on XX/XX/XXXX Account Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Opened on XX/XX/XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX - Opened on XX/XX/XXXX Account Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Opened on XX/XX/XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Opened on XX/XX/XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - Opened on XX/XX/XXXX Unauthorized Inquiries : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX FIN XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX These accounts have resulted in several fraudulent hard inquiries and fraudulent collections appearing on my consumer XXXX credit report. I've attached a list of the hard inquiries in question as well as a copy of the consumer XXXX credit report maintained by you which shows the aforementioned fraudulent items. I do not recognize the aforementioned accounts, collections, or hard inquiries as reported. The aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries appearing on my consumer credit report maintained by you were not opened, made, or initiated by me. All of the aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud. I have attached a copy of FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # XXXX as proof from the US Federal Trade Commission that all of the aforementioned consumer credit accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, VA XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX I disputed this account through your online process on XX/XX/XXXX Dear Equifax Team, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy of certain information in my consumer file, as provided under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). 

The details of the disputed information are as follows : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX I noticed my credit reports are reflecting inaccurate information. One report date of the last activity is missing, this fact is considered inaccurate information that has been reported like this for over 3 years. This account needs to be deleted from my credit report effective immediately. 

I request a free reinvestigation of this information, as required by law. I believe this information is inaccurate for the following reasons : Date of last activity should be the same. Stop sending stall letters stating you can't locate a credit file, and that the information is erroneous. 

As mandated, I expect the reinvestigation to be completed within the 30-day period from the date you receive this letter. If the disputed information is found to be inaccurate, I request that it be deleted from my file, and that I receive a corrected copy of my credit report reflecting these changes. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely,

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Cease and Desist and Dispute of Debt Collection Reporting To Whom It May Concern, This letter serves as a formal dispute of the debt you are attempting to collect and as a notification that I am exercising my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 USC 1692c ( c ), to request that you cease all further communication with me regarding this alleged debt. Additionally, I am disputing the accuracy of the reporting of this debt on my credit report, as governed by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 USC 1681e ( b ). The debt in question is as follows : 1. Accou
nt Name :XXXX XXXX XXXX Amount Alleged Owed : XXXX XXXX XXXX  Request to Cease Communication Under 15 USC 1692c ( c ), you are hereby notified to cease all communication with me regarding this debt. Any further communication, other than those allowed by law, will be considered a violation of the FDCPA and subject to legal action. 
Dispute of Debt and Reporting I dispute the validity of this debt and the accuracy of its reporting on my credit report. The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 USC 1681e ( b ), requires that credit reporting agencies maintain maximum possible accuracy in their reporting. If you can not provide verifiable proof that this debt is valid and belongs to me, it must be removed from my credit report immediately.

Action Requested Provide Validation : Send me documentation validating the debt, including the original contract and payment history. 

Cease Communication : Cease all further attempts to contact me regarding this debt as per 15 USC 1692c ( c ). 

Update Credit Report : If the debt can not be verified, remove it from my credit report and confirm in writing that it has been deleted. 

Please consider this letter a formal dispute under both the FDCPA and FCRA. Failure to comply with these laws will leave me no choice but to report your violations to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my state Attorney Generals office. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving your response within the timeframe required by law. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Subject : Formal Dispute and Request for Immediate Resolution Under 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) and 15 USC 1681e ( b ) To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to formally dispute the reinsertion of an account previously deleted from my credit report, as this action constitutes a violation of 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ). Additionally, I request immediate verification of the accounts accuracy and ownership under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

**Account Information : ** Creditor : XXXX XXXX  According to 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ), if an item is deleted from a consumers credit file as a result of a dispute, it can not be reinserted without proper notification and certification of its accuracy. I have reviewed my credit report and discovered that this account was deleted and later reinserted without such notification. This action is unlawful and constitutes a breach of my rights under the FCRA. 

Furthermore, under 15 USC 1681e ( b ), consumer reporting agencies are required to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. The reinsertion of this account without proper verification undermines this obligation. I believe this reinsertion is inaccurate and demands immediate correction.

**Requested Actions : ** 1. Remove the aforementioned account from my credit report immediately due to its unlawful reinsertion.

2. Provide me with all documentation and verification that this account is mine, as required by the FCRA.

3. Cease any further reporting of this accou
nt unless and until its accuracy is fully validated.

4. Notify me in writing within five ( 5 ) business days of the completion of these actions, as mandated by law.

Please be advised that if these violations are not addressed promptly, I will have no choice but to pursue legal action for damages as permitted under the FCRA. Your failure to comply with federal regulations has negatively impacted my credit profile, causing undue harm. 

I have attached a copy of my ID and proof of address to facilitate your investigation. Please consider this letter a formal complaint, and I expect a written response within 30 days, as required by law. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Attachments : 1. Copy of ID 2. Proof of Address 3. Copy of Credit Report Showing Disputed Account

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Reporting and Request for XXXX Documentation To Whom It May Concern, I am disputing the accuracy of an account listed on my credit report under 15 USC 1681s-2 , which mandates the reporting of accurate and verifiable information.

The account in question is as follows : 1. Account Name : XXXX XXXX Date Listed : XXXX XXXX, XXXX  The balance currently being reported is inaccurate and potentially unlawful. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, the issuance of a XXXX form by a creditor indicates the occurrence of an identifiable event of debt cancellation. Under IRS regulations, Event Code 7 defines such an event as a discharge of indebtedness due to the creditors policy decision to cease collection activity and cancel the debt. 

If a XXXX form has been issued for this account, the debt has been canceled, and reporting a balance is inaccurate and misleading. I am requesting the following : Verification of the Account Balance : Provide evidence demonstrating that the balance is accurate and collectible. 

Provision of the XXXX Form : If issued, provide a copy to verify the identifiable event. 
Immediate Deletion of the Account : If the debt was discharged under Event Code 7 or can not be verified, you are required to delete this negative information under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 

Attached, you will find [ list of supporting documents ]. Please investigate this matter within the legally required XXXX timeframe. Failure to respond appropriately will result in further action. 

Thank you for your prompt attention. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to express my extreme dissatisfaction and concern regarding the unresolved status of my previous dispute about unauthorized inquiries on my credit report, which I submitted on [ XX/XX/year> ] followed on [ XX/XX/year> ] and followed up on [ XX/XX/year> ]. This is my final attempt to resolve this matter amicably. I demand an immediate resolution in accordance with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ). 
Unauthorized Inquiries in Question XXXX XX/XX/year> XXXX XX/XX/year> Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) requires an immediate investigation of disputed information. It has been more than 30 days since my initial dispute, and I have yet to receive an adequate resolution, which is unacceptable. 
Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) entitles me to access all information in my file, including the results of your investigation. To date, I have not received the required information, which constitutes a violation of my rights.

Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. These inquiries were made without my consent and do not meet any permissible purpose under this section, representing a serious infraction.

Immediate Action Required I demand immediate action to resolve this dispute. Specifically, I request the following : 1. Thorough and Immediate Reinvestigation : Conduct a complete and urgent reinvestigation of the unauthorized inquiries.

2. Immediate Removal of Unauthorized Inquiries : Remove any inquiries found to be unauthorized from my credit report without delay.

3. Updated Credit Report : Provide me with an updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes immediately.

4. Detailed and Documented Notification : Inform me in detail of the steps taken and the results of your investigation within 15 days of receipt of this letter. Include documentation supporting your actions. 
Warning of Legal Action If I do not receive a satisfactory resolution within the specified timeframe, I will escalate this issue to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and proceed with legal action to protect my rights as a consumer. I will not hesitate to seek compensation for any damages resulting from your failure to adequately resolve this matter. 
I expect your immediate response and resolution to this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The late payment reporting by XXXX XXXX to credit bureaus is unfair and inaccurate under 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( a ), which establishes Congress 's findings on the need for fairness, accuracy, and respect for consumer privacy in credit reporting. Heres how : Inaccuracy Undermines the Banking System : Section 1681 ( a ) ( 1 ) emphasizes that the banking system depends on accurate credit reporting. XXXX XXXX reporting of a late payment, if inaccurate or disputable, compromises the reliability of the banking and credit system and unfairly harms me as a consumer. 
Unfair Practices in Reporting : Section 1681 ( a ) ( 4 ) obligates creditors and credit reporting agencies to handle information with fairness and respect for the consumer 's right to privacy. XXXX XXXX actions in this case fail to uphold these principles, as they reported the payment as late despite my compliance with applicable consumer protection laws or a misunderstanding that could have been resolved before reporting. 
Breach of Responsibility to Ensure Accuracy : Section 1681 ( b ) requires consumer reporting systems to operate fairly, equitably, and accurately while protecting confidentiality. XXXX XXXX late payment reporting fails to meet this standard, introducing errors into my credit file that unfairly damage my reputation and creditworthiness. 
Violation of Payment Timing Protections ( 15 U.S.C. 1666b ) : Under 15 U.S.C. 1666b, creditors may not treat payments on open-end credit plans as late if received by XXXX XXXX. on the due date and in the correct amount and format. If XXXX XXXX reported my payment as late despite compliance with these conditions, it constitutes a direct violation of this rule, further highlighting the unfairness of their reporting. 
Request for Resolution To address this issue and restore fairness, I request that XXXX XXXX : Immediately remove the late payment entry from my credit report. 
Inform all relevant credit reporting agencies of this correction to ensure that my credit history is accurately reflected. 
This resolution is necessary to uphold the principles of accuracy, fairness, and consumer protection enshrined in the Fair Credit Reporting Act and the Truth in Lending Act.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate and fraudulent information being reported on my credit file. As per FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), I am requesting the immediate removal of the following information that has resulted from identity theft : Account : [ XXXXXXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX ] Inquiries : [ XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ] [ XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ] [ XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ] Relevant Provisions of FCRA 605B Under the FCRA, a consumer reporting agency must block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as resulting from identity theft. Specifically : 1. Timely Action Required : According to FCRA 605B ( a ), Equifax must block the disputed information no later than four business days after receiving the following : Proof of my identity. 

A copy of my identity theft report. 

Identification of the fraudulent information. 

A statement from me asserting that the information is not the result of any transaction I authorized. 



2. Notification Obligation : As required by FCRA 605B ( b ), Equifax must promptly notify the furnishers of the information about the identity theft claim, the requested block, and the effective dates of the block. 3. Limits on Declining or Rescinding the Block : Equifax may only decline or rescind a block under very specific circumstances, as outlined in FCRA 605B ( c ). Any decision to decline or rescind a block must be accompanied by prompt notification to me, including an explanation as required by FCRA 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) (
B ).

Action Requested I demand the following actions : 1. Immediate removal of the fraudulent account and inquiries identified above.


2. Notification to all furnishers of the fraudulent nature of the account and inquiries. 3. Written confirmation within 30 days that the disputed information has been removed or blocked, as required under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Reporting and Request for 1099-C Documentation To Whom It May Concern, I am disputing the accuracy of an account listed on my credit report under 15 USC 1681s-2 , which mandates the reporting of accurate and verifiable information.

The account in question is as follows : 1. Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX The balance currently being reported is inaccurate and potentially unlawful. Per Gugger v. USAA Federal Bank, the issuance of a 1099-C form by a creditor indicates the occurrence of an identifiable event of debt cancellation. Under IRS regulations, Event Code 7 defines such an event as a discharge of indebtedness due to the creditors policy decision to cease collection activity and cancel the debt.

If a 1099-C form has been issued for this account, the debt has been canceled, and reporting a balance is inaccurate and misleading. I am requesting the following : Verification of the Account Balance : Provide evidence demonstrating that the balance is accurate and collectible.

Provision of the 1099-C Form : If issued, provide a copy to verify the identifiable event.

Immediate Deletion of the Account : If the debt was discharged under Event Code 7 or can not be verified, you are required to delete this negative information under the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

Please investigate this matter within the legally required 30-day timeframe. Failure to respond appropriately will result in further action.

Thank you for your prompt attention. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern, I am writing to file a complaint regarding the APR on my credit card, which at one point exceeded the range of the offered APR. While I understand that the APR is variable and tied to changes in the federal funds rate, I am concerned because my credit score is currently above XXXX, I have never missed a payment, did not carry a balance on the card for many months, and have payed off in full when utilized.

Initially, my APR was around 23 %, which was at the lower end of the offered range. However, it recently increased to the maximum APR, and at one point, it even exceeded the highest offered APR. This makes me believe I may have been incorrectly penalized at some point.

Unfortunately, when I reached out to Chase, I was told that no resolution was available and that there was no additional information I could receive. I was instead provided with the corporate offices mailing address.

I would appreciate it if this matter could be thoroughly investigated and resolved, as I believe I have been unfairly assigned an APR that exceeds the offered range for someone with my credit profile. Ultimately, what I am concerned about is the lack of oversight in calculating customers creditworthiness and the predatory nature of misinformation being provided by Chase.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. Updates on how this is being handled would be greatly appreciated.

Sub-product: Home equity loan or line of credit (HELOC)
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Difficulty submitting a dispute or getting information about a dispute over the phone
Consumer complaint narrative: We had a HELOC that was transferred to Shellpoint in XXXX. The loan has a fixed rate of 2 % and minimum payment of {$370.00} a month. When it was first transferred, they had it as a variable rate with different payment amounts. It took nine months, XXXX to XXXX, to get it resolved. From XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX, it was correct with the 2 % fixed rate and payment of {$370.00}. We received notification of our loan being transferred from Shellpoint to another loan company as of XX/XX/XXXX. We then received notification that the previous notification was sent in error and the loan was not being transferred. We received the XXXX statement due XX/XX/XXXX and it had gone back to a variable rate with a higher payment. Called XX/XX/XXXX and asked for it to be resolved and was given reference number XXXX. Called back on XX/XX/XXXX to make payment because it would not allow me to make my normal payment amount online or through automated phone system because it was less than the minimum amount they were showing due. Took payment with reference number XXXX. Called back on XX/XX/XXXX for an update and was told that my original note was for a variable rate and they need the paperwork showing a fixed rate. Made a payment over the phone with reference number XXXX. We tried to obtain paperwork from original loan company. On XX/XX/XXXX a gentleman dropped off a letter stating our loan was past due and our house was at risk for foreclosure. We were able to find the documentation that showed the 2 % fixed rate and payment of {$370.00}. I emailed it to XXXX and XXXX as I was instructed to do in the past. I also called to have it looked into again and make a payment. Payment was made over the phone with reference number XXXX. Called again on XX/XX/XXXX and it was to have been escalated. On XX/XX/XXXX another letter was delivered. On XX/XX/XXXX called and spoke with XXXX XXXX XXXX explained my situation and he then transferred me to a gentleman in loss mitigation. He then transferred me to a XXXX who told me nothing was being done because I need to submit my request in writting by mail to Shellpoint. I demanded speaking with a supervisor because I keep getting told different things and need this resolved. Spoke with XXXX XXXX. She told me I need to speak with someone in the HELOC department and said that a XXXX from HELOC credit would be calling me. I never received a call and had to call back on XX/XX/XXXX. Initially spoke with XXXX and asked to be transferred to a supervisor. I was then transferred to XXXX again. Told her I never received a call. She then got in contact with XXXX again and asked that she call me. XXXX then called me and said that she sees that it should be a 2 % fixed rate with a payment of {$370.00} and that she was reviewing my open work order. She put in a work order to get all of my payments applied properly and then to correct the payment amount on the account. She also took a payment with reference number XXXX. XXXX said she would monitor my account. She said it should be XXXX business days for payments to be applied and XXXX business days for payment calculations to be corrected but it was escalted so should be XXXX business days. She said she would follow up with me. If nothing, call back and ask for her. It is now XX/XX/XXXX, no one has contacted me and this has still not been resolved. My XXXX statement is still showing past due with an incorrect payment amount.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on to be inaccurate. 

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shalli ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.
