Consumer complaint narrative:
I obtained my Equifax credit report on line. There were U. S. Bankruptcy Court items listed on my credit reports. Per the FCRA 623 ( a ) ( 5 ) : If the Credit Bureau can not VALIDATE the information with the ORIGINAL CREDITOR, they must remove said information from the consumer credit file.

The Bankruptcy Courts have mailed me letters which emphatically stated that they do NOT provide any information to credit reporting agencies, nor do they ever validate and/or confirm public records. It is the credit reporting agencies, and/or other third party providers who collect information regarding public cases from public records. Public records information is NEVER validated by the U. S. Court system due to the Fair Credit Reporting Agency PRIVACY LAW.

My inquiry to the U. S. Bankruptcy Courts confirmed Equifax Credit Bureau has never validated or verified these public record entries on my credit report, neither will they ever be by them. They further stated while they are NOT liable or responsible for any MISUSE or INCORRECT public records, nor the distribution of said information, public records may, and oftentimes are, reported by third party sources unawares to the consumer, and in most cases, incorrectly. Considering the information indicating a Fair Credit Reporting Act violation, I need all tax lien and bankruptcy information currently showing under my social security number to be PERMANENTLY DELETED from my credit report immediately.

The EQUIFAX Credit Bureau needs to provide me with copies of all documentation associated with these Public Record Accounts bearing either a court order to place this information in my credit report, or my authorization of release bearing my signature. In the meantime, to be in full compliance with the FCRA laws and guidelines, all the information listed under Public Records needs to be immediately deleted from the credit file you maintain under my name and social security number. Be further advised that I am closely monitoring my credit file. Per the Federal Law, you have exactly 30 days to complete this investigation as outlined per the Fair Credit Reporting Act 623 ( a ) ( 3 ).

Per the Federal Credit Reporting Act, Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ), you are required by federal law to verify through physical verification of the original signed consumer contract and/or judgment ( XXXX ) all accounts and public information that you post on anyones credit report. Otherwise, anyone paying for your reporting services could fax, mail, email in fraudulent and erroneous account information. As such, if this unauthorized public record information is not deleted from my credit report within the next 30 days, I will be filing a complaint to the Federal Trade Commission, Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. 
Failure to respond in a satisfactory manner within 30 days of receipt of this certified letter will result in a small claims action against the EQUIFAX Credit Reporting Bureau. I will be seeking no less than {$5000.00} in damages for, but not limited to : 1 ) Defamation ; 2 ) Negligent Enhancement of Identity Fraud ; 3 ) Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act and Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against Equifax for their continued failure to investigate and remove fraudulent accounts and outdated personal information from my credit report, in direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Despite multiple disputes and submission of the required documentation, Equifax has failed to take appropriate action, claiming that they have not received the necessary evidencea blatant falsehood. 

The fraudulent accounts on my credit report are the result of identity theft stemming from the Equifax data breach, which exposed my personal information to criminals. I have already submitted updated identification and documentation to Equifax multiple times, yet these inaccuracies remain unresolved. The fraudulent accounts that Equifax continues to report include : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX In addition to the fraudulent accounts, Equifax has failed to remove outdated and fraudulent addresses tied to these accounts, including : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, CA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX NY XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX PA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, GA XXXX These addresses are not associated with me, and I have provided proof of identity theft and the data breach as well as updated identification. Equifaxs continued inaction perpetuates inaccuracies on my credit report, harming my creditworthiness and financial stability. 

Equifax has claimed on multiple occasions that they did not receive my documentation, despite my providing clear and verifiable evidence. This is not only a failure of compliance but also an attempt to obstruct the resolution of my disputes. Such behavior directly violates the FCRA, which mandates that credit reporting agencies : Conduct reasonable and thorough investigations of disputes within 30 days.

Remove inaccurate, unverifiable, or fraudulent information promptly. 
Provide transparency and clear documentation of their investigative process. 
By failing to act, Equifax has demonstrated negligence and disregard for federal law. Their inaction has caused ongoing harm, including financial loss, emotional distress, and damage to my credit profile.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the inaccurate reporting of the following charge-off entries on my credit report : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX These entries are inaccurate and violate my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). I demand an immediate investigation and correction of these inaccuracies to ensure compliance with federal law. 

Violations of Federal Law 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of any disputed information within 30 days. Failure to do so is a violation of federal law.

15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) : Mandates that credit reporting agencies maintain reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. The reporting of these inaccurate charge-offs violates this provision. 



2. Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : 15 U.S. Code 1692g : Debt collectors must validate any debt upon request. If a charge-off can not be validated, it is unlawful for the creditor or debt collector to continue reporting the account.

3. Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : 15 U.S. Code 1635 : Creditors must provide accurate and fair disclosures related to the terms and validity of debts. Reporting charge-offs without proper documentation may constitute a violation of this statute.

Damages and Remedies If these inaccuracies are not corrected promptly, I reserve the right to pursue legal remedies under the FCRA and FDCPA, including : Statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation.

Actual damages caused by these inaccuracies, such as increased interest rates, credit denials, or emotional distress.

Punitive damages for willful noncompliance with federal statutes.

Recovery of legal fees and associated costs.

Action Requested I demand the following actions : 1. Conduct a thorough investigation of these accounts to verify their accuracy.

2. Remove the inaccurate charge-off entries from my credit report immediately.

3. Provide a written statement confirming the removal or correction of these entries within 30 days, as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ).

Next Steps Failure to comply with these demands will leave me no choice but to file complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and other relevant regulatory bodies. Additionally, I will consult legal counsel to pursue remedies under federal law for the harm caused by these inaccuracies. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Heres a letter tailored for your situation with XXXX : [ Your Full Name ] [ Your Address ] [ City, State, ZIP Code ] [ Date ] Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX Re : Complaint Against XXXX  for Failing to Provide a XXXX and Inaccurate Reporting Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to file a formal complaint against XXXX regarding their failure to provide IRS Form XXXX documentation for an account they claim has been charged off. This failure raises significant concerns about the accuracy of the information being reported to credit bureaus. 

Account Details : Creditor Name : XXXX  Account Balance : {$180.00} Account Open Date : XX/XX/XXXX Continued Reporting : Monthly reporting through XX/XX/XXXX, and still ongoing today. 

I have contacted XXXX requesting a copy of the XXXX form to verify their reporting of this debt as canceled or discharged. However, they have failed to provide the requested documentation or any evidence supporting the continued reporting of this account. 

Moreover, this account has been reported monthly as an active account even after its alleged charge-off date, which further raises concerns about its accuracy. Such reporting may be in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), as it misrepresents the status of the debt. 

Actions Requested : XXXX. Investigate XXXX failure to provide the requested XXXX form for the account listed above. 
XXXX. Verify whether XXXX properly discharged the debt and issued the required documentation to the IRS. 
XXXX. If XXXX can not provide proper documentation, require them to immediately remove any inaccurate or negative reporting related to this account from my credit report. 
XXXX. Address the issue of XXXX continued reporting of this account as active or delinquent despite the alleged charge-off. 


I respectfully request that the CFPB intervene to ensure that XXXX complies with federal laws, including the FCRA, and that accurate reporting standards are maintained. Please let me know if additional information or documentation is required. 

Thank you for your time and assistance in resolving this matter.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem

Consumer complaint narrative:
Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Account XXXX  ( Account Number : XXXX ) Dear Equifax XXXX I am writing to formally contest the validity of the debt associated with XXXX, account number XXXX. I submitted a written request for verification of this account on XX/XX/XXXX, as required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), particularly Section 609 ( a ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), which mandates that consumers have the right to access accurate information in their files. To date, I have not received any legitimate verification or satisfactory response from your agency.

Upon reviewing my credit report, I have identified several discrepancies regarding the handling of this XXXX  account : Last Payment Date : The last payment date reported varies among agencies ; for instance, XXXX and XXXX reflect a payment on XX/XX/XXXX, yet the Equifax report lacks clarity in this respect. 

XXXX XXXX : All reporting agencies indicate a balance of {$0.00}, which raises significant questions about the consistency and accuracy of this account 's reporting. 

Date of Last Activity : Equifax states the date of last activity was XX/XX/XXXX, while other agencies show differing dates ( e.g., XX/XX/XXXX with XXXX ). This inconsistency warrants immediate clarification. 

Account Status Variations : The account status is reported as " Closed '' across various agencies, yet the accompanying payment statuses ( such as " Collection '' or " Charge-Off '' ) create confusion regarding its standing.

Derogatory Reporting : There is conflicting information regarding the derogatory status of this account, with it being marked as " Paid '' in some instances while indicated as " Derogatory '' elsewhere, which could adversely affect my credit score.

Furthermore, your failure to respond to my request for verification of the debt within the FCRA standard timeframe constitutes a violation of my rights under the FCRA, as it undermines my ability to challenge the accuracy of the information reported and ensures that unverifiable debt remains on my credit report. 

Given the lack of proper validation of this XXXX account and the discrepancies outlined above, I demand the immediate deletion of this account from my credit report. The FCRA stipulates that if a debt can not be properly verified, it must be removed. 

I expect your prompt attention to this matter and anticipate a resolution within the legally required timeframe. Please confirm receipt of this complaint and inform me of the steps that will be taken moving forward. 

Thank you for your cooperation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information reported to the credit reporting agencies regarding my account with XXXX XXXX XXXX Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other relevant laws, I am entitled to accurate and verifiable information on my credit report. 

Details of the Dispute : Account Details : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account ) Inaccurate Reporting : Late payments, including 120 days past due, have been inaccurately reported across multiple months, despite discrepancies in timing and reporting across credit bureaus ( Equifax and XXXX ) XXXX 
Legal Concerns Raised : Permissible Purpose ( FCRA Section 604 ) : You are required to ensure that any information shared with credit reporting agencies is accurate and only for permissible purposes. The reporting of inaccurate delinquency status violates this obligation and infringes upon my rights under the FCRA. 

Privacy Act of 1974 : I have not provided consent to share or report incorrect and unverifiable information. Reporting incorrect details not only violates the FCRA but could also constitute a breach of my privacy rights under the Privacy Act of 1974. 

Timing of Payments ( FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ) ) : Under the FCRA, furnishers of credit information must ensure the accurate timing of delinquencies and ensure consistency across all bureaus. The reported 120 days past due status lacks proper timing verification, as evident from the discrepancies in the reporting date.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX XX/XX/2024 Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX **Subject : ** Formal Complaint Against XXXX XXXX XXXX for Inaccurate Credit Reporting Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau , I am writing to file a formal complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX for ongoing and inaccurate reporting of a closed account on my credit report. Despite this account being closed, XXXX XXXX continues to report balance updates, which is both misleading and in violation of the XXXX*Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) **. These inaccuracies are negatively affecting my credit standing and causing significant distress. 

**Details of the Issue : ** - The account in question ( Account Number : XXXX ) has been closed ; however, XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX continues to update the balance as though the account is active. This is inaccurate and constitutes false reporting under the FCRA. 
- This repeated inaccuracy has been reported to credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax ) but remains unresolved. 

The FCRA requires that all information reported to credit bureaus be accurate, complete, and up to date. XXXXXXXX XXXX failure to correct this issue is a clear violation of my rights under federal law. As a result, I am requesting immediate action by the CFPB to address this matter. 

**Resolution Requested : ** XXXX. I demand that this account be **immediately removed** from all three credit reports ( XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax ) due to its inaccurate and misleading reporting. 
XXXX. I request that XXXX XXXX XXXX cease all further reporting of this account and any related balance updates. 

Failure to resolve this issue promptly will result in my pursuit of legal action, including seeking damages for each inaccuracy related to this account, as permitted under the FCRA. 

**Supporting Documentation : ** Enclosed are the following documents to support my complaint : - A copy of my recent credit report showing the inaccurate reporting. 
- Documentation confirming the accounts closed status. 

I trust the CFPB will take immediate and appropriate action to ensure compliance with federal regulations and protect my rights as a consumer. Please confirm receipt of this complaint and provide me with a timeline for your investigation and resolution. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX **Enclosures : ** 1. Copy of Credit Report 2. Proof of Account Closure

Consumer complaint narrative:
My account with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX DEPT OF EDXXXX was never late! I have had exceptional payment history witH XXXX  XXXX and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. 

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family!

I demand the late payment reported in to be removed.

They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX AND DEPT OF ED/XXXX never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. 

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! 

Delete the late payments from my consumer reports

In accordance with the fair credit reporting act, the list of accounts below has violated my federally reporting consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15usc 1681, I understand that consumer reports may only be accessed for permissible purposes, such as evaluating creditworthiness for a legitimate credit transaction initiated by the consumer. 

XACTUS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CT XXXXXXXX Date of inquiry XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, NY XXXX Date of inquiry XX/XX/XXXX XACTUS LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MD XXXX Date of inquiry XX/XX/XXXX XACTUS LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MD XXXX XXXX of inquiry. XXXX/XXXX/XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Date of inquiry XX/XX/XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Date of inquiry XX/XX/XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Date of inquiry XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Date of inquiry XX/XX/XXXX As the consumer, I am the lawful owner of my credit information, which means any entity seeking to access or use it must do so with explicit authorization and solely for permissible purposes. 15 u.s.c 1681 section 602 15 u.s.c 1681 section 604 Reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written authorization consent. Also any negative items report on XXXX credit bureau must be '' Deleted '' and removed from my credit report. Sincerely; thanks I appreciate.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I called in multiple times today. First off spoke with some guy named XXXX, I had a couple questions about a balance transfer. I asked to speak with the supervisor in order to prevent my time from being wasted in the process. I gave him my full name and my full social security number simply because I did not want to go into the other room and grab the card number. So I asked him to verify the account using my social hence provided him that for that reason in the process, for whatever reason, he transferred me to a fraud department rep named XXXX who rudely wasted my time transfer me to supervisor named. XXXX refused to provide me her name and stated he could not provide people 's names which is untrue and XXXX verified that that was also false. XXXX was not able to get XXXX on the phone after she said that was her supervisor. She came back with some lady named XXXX XXXX who stated that she was not a supervisor that they were in the fraud department and that essentially after establishing all that all this time had been wasted because I called in about a balance transfer question and XXXX transfer me over to the fraud department. XXXX didn't ask any questions. Simply wasted my time and then made things more difficult than they had to be after my time was wasted with XXXX extensively. I gave up and then tried to reach my app later on which I had no problems with prior to me calling in earlier and speaking with XXXX and mind you, I did forget I did call in twice before speaking with XXXX and was hung up on as well by two different people. The only person I can remember the name of who hung up on me earlier that time was XXXX. Small world cuz I think I've spoke with XXXX before and she treated me similar to XXXX tonight in the sense that. When I saw my app had now been limited for whatever reason from the four digits of the card, I tried to attempt to ask somebody some questions earlier, which I never was even able to ask the questions based on the processes and procedures that were put in front of me after incorrectly being transferred to XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

On the call place to Citibank where XXXX picked up after my app was limited access, I provided him my security word within 1 minute of the phone call beginning. I asked him to please get a supervisor on the phone as soon as possible to prevent any time from being wasted more so than it already has been. He said that he would get one quickly. I said amazing. Almost 11 minutes went by while he had me on mute. He never came back to check once. He never provided any update in the process. After waiting that long I stated hey XXXX, I'm going to file a consumer financial protection bureau complaint now based on you leaving me on hold for almost 11 minutes with your mute button and not coming back to check in one time. Sure enough. As soon as I said that here he is responding. What do you know?. When he transferred the call to a XXXX earlier, he refused to give her name. XXXX stated that he can give the people 's names and he had no reason to tell me differently. He refused to give the names once again tonight and after 32 minutes I finally got on the phone with a XXXX who I asked to file a complaint against XXXX for his behaviors and wasting my time and refusing to provide people 's names on multiple occasions and placing people on hold for 11 minutes at a time with the mute button and never checking in. I asked him to please provide me the case ID when this was done and I would politely wait. That never happened. XXXX seemed confused and wanted to play stupid even though I outlined exactly what I needed his help with when the account had now been verified three times in the last hour.. the call disconnected. XXXX never called me back. I have no case ID. There's nothing to show that XXXX had anything filed against him and he essentially wasted over 32 minutes of my time before a quote '' manager from call center hopped on the phone. 

This is truly unacceptable and beyond a waste of my time.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
ISSUE DESCRIPTION On the morning of XX/XX/year>, I joined XXXX XXXX XXXX, opened a savings account, and deposited funds. Following this, I connected my new savings account to my almost decade-old Coinbase account through XXXX and initiated a deposit and a buy order. Immediately upon submitting the transaction, a window appeared stating, " Buy Services Disabled. '' ISSUE RESOLUTION ATTEMPTS Coinbase Chat Support : I initiated a chat with Coinbase support, waiting approximately 4 hours to connect with a live agent, XXXX. 

XXXX informed me that my account was " under review '' but refused to provide a specific reason for the restriction. Instead, I would receive an email update within 1-3 business days.

When I asked under what circumstances Coinbase would not lift the restrictions and what actions I could take to restore full functionality, XXXX vaguely mentioned that they may request additional documents to confirm my account. However, she did not specify what documents or provide clear instructions. 

XXXX also emphasized that the restriction was due to " security reasons. '' Despite this, other features of my account, such as deposits, sales, and withdrawals, remained fully functional. This contradiction raised serious concerns about the rationale for restricting only the buying feature if my account was genuinely " under review '' for security reasons. 

When I continued to press XXXX for specific details and actionable steps, she abruptly ended the chat. 

Coinbase does not persist chat records, meaning all details of my conversation with XXXX were lost when she closed the chat. 

Coinbase Phone Support : Concurrently, I used Coinbase 's " request a call '' feature for phone support. 
I was placed on hold for an additional 5 hours and ultimately never received a response. 

COINBASE 'S FOLLOW-UP EMAIL : On the morning of XX/XX/year>, I received an email from Coinbase, which read as follows : " Hi [ Name ], We have completed your account review, and buy/deposit services remain disabled at this time. 

You are still able to send/sell and withdraw any cryptocurrency you currently have on Coinbase and withdraw funds to your existing payment method.

As a trusted crypto exchange, we take a number of steps to keep all accounts safe, and we regularly monitor customer accounts to ensure compliance with our terms of service. For security reasons, we're not able to provide you with any additional information at this time. If you need support with the enabled services on your account, please reach out to Coinbase Support. 

Regards, The Coinbase team '' Despite claiming to have " completed '' the review, Coinbase : - Provided no actionable steps or recourse to restore my accounts buying functionality. 
- Failed to request the " additional documents '' XXXX mentioned in the chat. 
- Refused to disclose the specific reason for the restriction, again citing vague " security reasons. '' Note that Coinbase sent this email at XXXXXXXX XXXX in the middle of the night, all but guaranteeing I wouldn't see the email for several hours and delaying my response. 

UNREASONABLE, CONTRADICTORY ACTIONS Coinbases actions contradict themselves and lack transparency. If they genuinely placed my account " under review '' for " security reasons, '' it is illogical and inconsistent to restrict buying and deposit services while still allowing other functions, such as withdrawals, sales, and deposits of cryptocurrency. This inconsistency undermines the credibility of Coinbase 's rationale and raises serious concerns about their practices. 

COINBASE 'S CASE HANDLING ISSUES 1. Lack of Transparency : Coinbase failed to provide specific reasons for the restriction, actionable steps to resolve it, or clear communication about the circumstances under which restrictions would remain. 
2. Unreasonable Wait Times : I experienced 4 hours of waiting for chat support and 5 hours on hold for phone support, neither of which resulted in a resolution. 
XXXX. Failure to Provide Recourse : XXXX mentioned the possibility of requesting additional documents, yet the follow-up email contained no such request or path to restoring account functionality. 
XXXX. Lack of Persisted Records : Coinbases failure to retain chat records resulted in the loss of critical information from my conversation with XXXX. 
XXXX. Contradictory Policy Implementation : Restricting buying services while leaving other features operational is inconsistent and raises questions about the validity of the " security reasons '' justification. 

REQUESTED RESOLUTION I demand the following : XXXX. A specific and immediate explanation for why my account was restricted. 
2. Clear, actionable steps to restore full functionality to my account.

3. A review of Coinbases support practices, including chat record retention, response times, and communication clarity.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information reported to the credit reporting agencies regarding my account with XXXX XXXX XXXX Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other relevant laws, I am entitled to accurate and verifiable information on my credit report. 

Details of the Dispute : Account Details : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account ) Inaccurate Reporting : Late payments, including 120 days past due, have been inaccurately reported across multiple months, despite discrepancies in timing and reporting across credit bureaus ( XXXX and XXXX ) XXXX 
Legal Concerns Raised : Permissible Purpose ( FCRA Section 604 ) : You are required to ensure that any information shared with credit reporting agencies is accurate and only for permissible purposes. The reporting of inaccurate delinquency status violates this obligation and infringes upon my rights under the FCRA. 

Privacy Act of 1974 : I have not provided consent to share or report incorrect and unverifiable information. Reporting incorrect details not only violates the FCRA but could also constitute a breach of my privacy rights under the Privacy Act of 1974. 

Timing of Payments ( FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ) ) : Under the FCRA, furnishers of credit information must ensure the accurate timing of delinquencies and ensure consistency across all bureaus. The reported 120 days past due status lacks proper timing verification, as evident from the discrepancies in the reporting date.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I filed a complaint requesting validation of debt by collection agency. In the request I am requesting the assignment contract agreement I was sent an copy of a loan Agreemnt and Installment note. Which is not what I asked for I need a copy of the assignment contract. 

A loan agreement is not the same as an assignment contract. A loan agreement outlines the terms of a loan between a lender and borrower, while an assignment contract is the document used to transfer rights and obligations under existing contract. 

Like an loan agreement to a third party, essentially allowing one party to assign their role in the contract to someone else. 

PLEASE. PROVIDE ME WITH THE ASSIGNMENT CONTRACT. NO OTHER DOCUMENTS ARE NEEDED TO PROVIDE YOU PLAZA SERVICES LLC HAS THE RIGHT TO COLLECT ALLEGED DEBT. 

If not provided I will forward this complaint on over to a Legal Repesentative Attorney FDCPA under 15 USC 1692g

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>XXXX  on my PayPal account under the email XXXX, I purchased an item from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for a total of {$960.00} using a Pay in 4 Plan. When the item arrived I noticed that parts were missing so I promptly contacted XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and they provided me a return label to return the items on XX/XX/year>. I've sent the item back on XX/XX/XXXX and on XX/XX/XXXX the items were delivered back to the seller who confirmed they received the items in an email I have attached below. Despite this confirmation by the seller that they were negligent in refunding me and after weeks I contacted PayPal to dispute the seller. 

After providing PayPal with all the information in the dispute, including communications, tracking number and more, the case was closed in the sellers favor after almost 2 months of waiting. The reason for the closure in the sellers favor was that I provided tracking info that couldn't be validated but l used the shipping label that the seller themselves gave me and they also confirmed the receiving the item. I've attached proof below that the seller is the one who sent me the shipping label. The tracking number for the return label is XXXX. So not only does the seller have the item, they are keeping my money hostage and will not return it. I've contacted the shipping company directly and they have confirmed to me as well that the item was delivered to the correct address on the shipping label, that was giving to me by the merchant. I've attached written proof from XXXX themselves showing this. 

After speaking with multiple customer service representatives on the phone using PayPals support number, they recognized that the case shouldve been closed in my favor but reopened the case under a different case type. The case was closed again. I once again spoke to customer service who changed it to the correct case type and it was closed again within minutes to sellers favor because I waited over 30 days. I submitted this case XX/XX/XXXX which is less than 30 days since the item was delivered to me. 

So again to clarify I provided the following to PayPal Proof that the seller confirmed they received the item Proof that the seller is the one who provided the shipping label for return The actual shipping label itself given to me by the seller via email Proof of delivery by XXXX showing it was delivered to the seller Multiple communications with the seller stating that they will refund me but they never have This is clearly fraudulent business practices on both the seller 's part as well as PayPal 's. This is a case of neither party- the seller or PayPal- abiding by their own refund and protections as listed on their respective websites. This needs to be fixed and I need my money back for the item I returned.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Can't use card to make purchases
Consumer complaint narrative:
Explanation of My Complaint : Recently, XXXX has begun drastically reducing credit limits for many cardholders, including myself, with little to no explanation or prior notice. On XX/XX/year>, I discovered that my XXXX credit limit had been slashed from {$32000.00} to {$5000.00} without any warning. I was not notified in advance, and the only communication I received was a vague email dated XX/XX/year>, citing a " periodic review '' as the reason for the reduction. 
This reduction had an immediate and detrimental impact : My credit utilization spiked from under 10 % to over 50 %, harming my credit score despite my responsible usage and perfect payment history. 
The change disrupted my ability to manage routine expenses, as my card was unexpectedly declined for a grocery order, stranding my family mid-transaction. 
Why This Is Unfair : Lack of Notice : I was not given advance warning or a clear opportunity to address any perceived risk factors. 
Arbitrary and Unexplained : The reasons provided, such as " periodic review, '' lack transparency and do not align with my financial behavior or payment history. 
Severe Financial Harm : The abrupt reduction caused unnecessary stress, credit score damage, and disruptions to essential transactions, like groceries or subscriptions. 
Desired Resolution : A complete investigation into XXXX practices, including their lack of transparency and failure to notify customers adequately. 
Restitution for affected customers, such as reinstatement of previous credit limits or compensation for credit score damage. 
Improved communication policies to ensure that customers are warned and given a chance to address concerns before such drastic actions are taken. 
This situation undermines trust in credit card issuers and highlights the need for accountability when companies make sweeping changes that harm their customers. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

For nearly 18 months now I have had to call the Apple Card/Goldman Sachs fraud line every 90 days to have these charges removed. They repeatedly make me go through the process of sending the police report and statements from my other credit card provider ( XXXX XXXX  ) showing that THEY removed the fraud charges incurred on that card. I also had to replace my driver 's license and create a new checking account with my bank, but Goldman has repeatedly investigated and told me that it was ME who spent this money. I have also told them that the businesses that the money was spent at were far outside the normal spending habits I had built ups on the card. As an Apple Card, it was primarily used to finance Apple products, with the rare purchase at XXXX, where I was employed at the time, or a rare fast food purchase. Today, XX/XX/XXXX, I received another round of emails telling me my fraud disputes were denied once again. I am attaching the police report, the email initiating my closing of the first checking account, and the XXXX statement for your reference. Please contact me if you have any questions and I am more than happy to speak to you about this experience.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXGoldman Sachs Dispute Refusal : XXXX placed an order for a closet through a website called XXXX using my Apple Card, and I received a confirmation email on XX/XX/year>. Months later, they sent me a large box containing a pile of wood with no assembly manual. After reviewing the contents, I believed I had received the wrong order, so I reached out to XXXX. What followed was a months-long back-and-forth via email. Eventually, I realized I had been scammed. A quick online search revealed numerous reports confirming that XXXX was a scam, with a clear pattern : they send incorrect products and refuse to issue refunds. ( For clarification, check website : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX account : XXXX XXXX, or reviews from XXXX, XXXX, XXXX  or communities such as XXXX ) I have documented evidence of every communication with XXXX, including receipts, the violated contract, testimonials from other victims, and screenshots of websites detailing the scam. Following XXXX 's Purchase Protection policy, I contacted Apple Card Support and submitted all relevant evidence. Despite this, after months of waiting, I was notified that my dispute was rejected. 

Undeterred, I reached out to Apple Card Support again, providing additional evidence in the hopes of clarifying the situation. Unfortunately, the dispute was rejected again, with no explanation. Recently, I discovered that there are ongoing lawsuits against XXXX and Goldman Sachs for mishandling similar disputes, which leads me to believe that the rejection had little to do with the evidence I submitted and more to do with flaws in the dispute resolution process.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Denial of Chargeback Claim Misleading XXXX XXXX Summary of the Issue : I am filing a complaint against Current Bank for denying my chargeback request related to a purchase made for a XXXX XXXX XXXX  from the website XXXX. The product was marketed as beginner-friendly, but it was not understandable for a new trader like myself, which goes against the advertised promise. Despite providing substantial evidence of misleading advertising and poor-quality service, my bank has denied my claim, leaving me with no recourse. I believe this decision is unjust and warrants review, particularly in light of the companys own refund policy and the additional admission that further training was required. 

1. Initial Purchase and Misleading Advertising : I purchased a fXXXX XXXX XXXX  from XXXX which was advertised as beginner-friendly. The FAQ section on the companys website clearly states : Is This Okay for Beginners? 
Yes, new and seasoned traders are welcomed. 

However, upon starting the program, I found that the material was far too advanced and provided no foundational instruction for beginners. The videos were disorganized and lacked in-depth explanations of key concepts such as liquidity, which were essential for understanding the material. 
2. Request for Refund and Denial from Merchant : Upon realizing that the bootcamp did not meet the advertised standard for beginners, I requested a refund from the company. Instead of granting the refund, they offered me an additional mentorship course valued at {$990.00}, stating : I am willing to place you in my mentorship coursedesigned for beginners for 60 days and the bootcamp will make sense to you after. 

This statement clearly implies that the bootcamp I initially purchased was not suitable for beginners as advertised. The companys attempt to sell me an additional course to clarify material that was supposed to be understandable from the start is an admission that their product did not align with its original claims. 
3. Refund Policy : The companys refund policy is restrictive and only offers refunds within 24 hours for technical issues, such as problems downloading the content or damaged files : Refund Policy : We understand that sometimes purchases may not meet your expectationsallows for a full refund within 24 hours of purchase date under the following conditions : item damaged, issues with downloading, not loading, etc. 

However, I am requesting a refund based on misleading advertising, which was not addressed in their refund policy. I should not be held to this restrictive refund window when the product fundamentally did not meet the expectations set by the advertising. 
4. Chargeback Request with Current Bank After being denied a refund by the merchant, I filed a chargeback request with [ Current Bank ], providing the above evidence, including : Screenshots of the misleading advertising on the merchants website. 
Email communication where the merchant indirectly admits the bootcamp was not suitable for beginners. 
A copy of the refund policy showing the restrictive nature of the refund process. 
Despite providing clear evidence of false advertising and a legitimate basis for a refund, [ Your Banks Name ] denied my chargeback request, leaving me with no recourse to recover my funds.

Reasons Why the Chargeback Should Be Approved : 1. Misleading Advertising : The product was advertised as being suitable for beginners, but it clearly was not. The merchant themselves admitted that I needed additional training to understand the content ( email correspondence attached ), which constitutes deceptive advertising.

2. Unjust Denial Based on Limited Refund Policy : The merchants restrictive refund policy does not cover situations involving misleading advertising, which is a clear consumer protection issue. I believe the bank should have taken this into account when reviewing my chargeback request.

3. Failure to Uphold Consumer Rights : Current Bank has failed to uphold my consumer rights by siding with the merchant despite the overwhelming evidence of a misrepresented product and refusal to grant a fair refund. Chargebacks are meant to protect consumers from situations exactly like this, and the denial of my claim is both unjust and contrary to these protections.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Notice of Dispute and Intent to File Arbitration Inclusion of Dismissed XXXX Dear LexisNexis Consumer Center, I am writing to formally dispute the inclusion of two XXXX records in my LexisNexis consumer report. These records are misleading, potentially inaccurate, and violate my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The details of the disputed XXXX  are as follows : XXXX  Filing Number : XXXX Filing Date : XX/XX/XXXX Disposition : Dismissed Disposition Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX Filing Number : XXXX Filing Date : XX/XX/XXXX Disposition : Dismissed Disposition Date : XX/XX/XXXX Reasons for Dispute : Dismissed XXXX Are Misleading : Both XXXX cases were dismissed, meaning there was no discharge of debts or continuation of proceedings. Including these records in my report without proper context misrepresents my financial status and negatively impacts my creditworthiness. 
Accuracy of Reporting : Under FCRA ( 607 ( b ) ), LexisNexis must ensure maximum possible accuracy in reporting consumer information. Reporting dismissed XXXX without adequate explanation or justification fails to meet this standard.

Permissible Purpose and Disclosure : If this information was disclosed to third parties without my explicit consent or a permissible purpose as required by FCRA ( 604 ), this constitutes a violation of my rights. 
Emotional Distress and Harm : The continued inclusion of inaccurate and misleading information has caused me significant emotional distress, as well as harm to my financial and professional reputation. 
XXXXexisNexiss Legal History : I am aware of the Class Action Lawsuit ( 2017 ), in which LexisNexis Risk Solutions was accused of reporting inaccurate XXXX details in credit reports. Plaintiffs alleged that LexisNexis reported incorrect XXXX  statuses, adversely affecting their creditworthiness. This demonstrates a pattern of inadequate practices in reporting XXXX data, further supporting my claim that my consumer report contains similar inaccuracies.

Requested Actions : Verification : Provide documentation verifying the accuracy and legality of including these dismissed XXXX in my report.

Correction/Removal : If you can not verify the accuracy and appropriateness of including these records, promptly remove them from my report.

Compensation : I am seeking {$5000.00} to resolve this matter due to the violations of my rights under FCRA and the emotional distress caused by the inaccurate reporting.

Disclosure of Recipients : Provide a list of all third parties who have accessed my consumer report containing the disputed information.

Intent to File Arbitration : If LexisNexis fails to resolve this matter within the 30 days allotted under the FCRA or refuses to remove these inaccurate entries and provide compensation, I will pursue arbitration under the terms of your service agreement.

I am aware that arbitration proceedings will cost LexisNexis significantly more than {$5000.00}, including lawyer fees, arbitration filing costs, and other related expenses. Resolving this matter promptly and fairly would be a more cost-effective and equitable solution for all parties involved.

Preferred Communication Method : I request that all correspondence related to this matter be sent to me via email at XXXX or by mail to my address listed above. I will not communicate over the phone, as I prefer to have everything in writing for my records. 

This Is Not a Joke : Please understand that I take this matter very seriously, and I expect LexisNexis to do the same. Any further delays or failure to address this dispute appropriately will result in legal action, including arbitration. 

Supporting Documentation : I have included the following to assist your investigation : A copy of my LexisNexis report with the disputed XXXX  highlighted. 
A copy of my government-issued ID for verification purposes. 

Please respond in writing within 30 days, as required by law, to confirm the resolution of this matter or provide evidence supporting the continued inclusion of these records. Failure to act promptly will leave me no choice but to escalate this matter to arbitration. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this dispute.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit card
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> : I realized my {$200.00} XXXX auto payment ( minimum payment due {$63.00} ) was split out significantly and Home Depot applied portions to separate charges that were not due. 

The balance due on my revolving ( interest ) was {$120.00}. They only applied {$62.00} to this balance and charged interest the the remaining amount ( for the XXXX month ). They applied the remaining payment portion of {$130.00} to charges that were not due until XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 

When I called and spoke with manager at customer support, I was told they will not/ can not apply my payment to the revolving even if I request it. Their 'system ' spits payments to balances due up to 2 months 'before " the due date and there is nothing I can do about that. At this point, I don't know how I can eliminate my revolving balance 100 % quickly based on how they apply my payment, except to pay 2 months early on my other balance -- which I do not want to do. 

According to what I read under the Credit Card Act, " Credit card companies must apply payment amounts " in excess of the minimum payment amount '' to a consumer 's highest interest rate balances first. '' This would be my revolving credit portion of the account. Why are they not doing that? 

I mentioned this to the customer service manager and he said they are applying them according to their terms and could not change it. I've been a cardholder with Home Depot for years, and have never had this experience. I'm wondering if their 'terms ' have changed in the fine print.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Consumer complaint narrative:
It has come to my attention that I have recently been discriminated against and my application for credits for a used vehicle were denied XXXX. My denial letter is proof of this discrimination. As a federally protected consumer, this is a direct violation of my consumer rights ; potential securities fraud. The moment I applied I chose to become an investor which means any person or entity that owns an obligation issued by an issuing entity. The application itself is considered a financial asset and security and I have not been given any equal consideration for my application for credits even though USAA has ran my personal information and credit history, and has accepted the application which creates and opens an account whether or not the credits Im applying for are given to me. The credit application is the asset provided to create collateral for the extension of credit. Credit can never be issued without collateral. Securities are to be received by the trustee simultaneously with the creation of the creditor relationship with the obligor arising from the making, drawing, negotiating or incurring of the draft, bill of exchange, appearance, or obligation. The Securities Exchange Act under lawful extension of credit, it states that it is unlawful to maintain or extend credit TO OR FOR any customer without collateral or on any other collateral securities. According to the filings listed with the SEC, USAA XXXX XXXX ; USAA Auto Owner Trust are responsible for securitizing and collateralizing the notes that USAA Federal Savings bank purchases. Pledging my credit application to create a security along with a collateral certificate and trying to assign the debt to me in the form of a loan is securities fraud. 

USAA has no right to deny me of an extension of credit when they are not lawfully allowed to give consumers loans nor having disclosed the fact you are only purchasing the underlying security and selling in on the secondary market. The underwriters initial propose is to offer the notes directly to the public at the public offering prices set forth on the cover page of the prospectus supplement for USAA and may offer the notes to certain dealers. These products and services are sold through various channels, including direct mail, online applications, in house and third party sales forces, and direct response advertising. The online application is a product/instrument in which USAA has already been compensated for. In addition, in the ordinary course of USAAs business activities, the underwriters and their affiliates may make or hold a broad array of investments and actively trade debt and equity securities ( or related derivative securities ) and financial instruments ( including bank loans ) for their own account and for the accounts of their customers. Such investments and securities activities may involve securities and/or instruments of yours or your affiliates. The underwriters and their affiliates may also make investment recommendations and/or publish or express independent research views in respect of such securities or financial instruments and may hold, or recommend to clients that they acquire, long and/ or short positions in such securities and instruments. Underwriters are actively trading debt securities or other financial instruments such loans and credit agreements.

You are required by law to provide these disclosures through an ABS-15G form with the SEC which requires asset backed securitizers to provide disclosures regarding fulfilled and unfulfilled repurchase request with respect to asset backed securities. The Terms of Notes detail the obligations and duties of the trust indentured. It states the company may from time to time, subject to compliance with any other applicable provisions of the indentured but with the consent of the holders of notes, create and issue pursuant to the indenture an unlimited principal amount of additional notes ( in excess of any amounts therefore issued ) having the same terms and conditions to those of the other outstanding notes, except that any such additional notes ( I ) may have have a different issue date and issue price from other outstanding notes and ( II ) may have a different amount of interest payable on the first interest payment date after issuance that is payable on other outstanding notes. Such additional notes shall constitute part of the same series of notes as the notes initially issued here under. Not only is USAA not providing me the credits I applied for, and selling my securities, but have the ability to sell the security multiple times for multiple values without giving me any of the security interest in return from my investment.

If compliance with your most recent SEC filings is not honored I will be forced to contact the SEC for violation your agreement. It seems USAA knoeingky intended to decieve me and I need this matter to be corrected. The adverse action that has taken place on my application needs to be reversed as it does not coincide with the disclosures provided to me or the Trust Indentured agreement on file with the SEC pursuant to the Securities Exchange Act.

Product: Debt collection
Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against Transworld Systems Inc. ( TSI ) for their failure to provide the required debt validation and their improper collection practices regarding an alleged debt they claim I owe to XXXX XXXX. Below are the details of the situation : Debt Collection Information : Collection Agency : Transworld Systems Inc. 
Reference/Account Number : XXXX Date of Initial Correspondence : XX/XX/XXXX Amount Allegedly Owed : {$1000.00} ( discrepancy noted below ) Summary of Issue : On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a communication from Transworld Systems Inc. attempting to collect a debt of {$1000.00} related to XXXX XXXX XXXX However, the amount stated in their letter does not match the amount shown on the statements they provided, which is {$900.00}. The difference of {$110.00} has not been explained or documented. 

I would like to make it clear that I do not owe any money to XXXX XXXX. I have no outstanding debt with them, and I have never been informed by XXXX XXXX that I owe anything. Furthermore, I am receiving multiple communications from various debt collectors regarding this same alleged debt, which has created confusion and concern regarding the legitimacy of the claim. 

Despite my request for debt validation, Transworld Systems Inc. responded by sending me multiple copies of the same monthly statement, but they did not provide the required documentation to verify the debt, including : Proof of the debt, including an itemized breakdown of all charges, fees, and interest. 
Documentation establishing that I am responsible for this debt. 
The name and address of the original creditor ( XXXX XXXX ). 
Evidence that the debt is correctly linked to my personal information. 
I have not received the necessary documentation within the required time frame, and Transworld Systems Inc. has failed to address the discrepancy between the amount owed and the amounts listed in the statements. 

Requested Resolution : I request that Transworld Systems Inc. provide the following : A full, itemized breakdown of the alleged debt, including all charges, interest, and fees.

Proof of the debt, including documentation that I am legally responsible for this debt.

The name and address of the original creditor.

Proper validation of the debt, including confirmation that the debt is correctly linked to my personal information.

Immediate correction of any inaccuracies on my credit report that may have been caused by unverified reporting of this debt. 
Cease all further collection efforts on this debt until proper documentation is provided.

Immediate correction of any false or inaccurate reports made by Transworld Systems Inc. to any credit reporting agency or third-party debt collectors regarding this alleged debt.

If Transworld Systems Inc. is unable or unwilling to provide the necessary validation and explanation of the debt, I ask that they cease collection activity and remove any false or inaccurate reports to credit bureaus regarding this alleged debt.

Additionally, I request that the CFPB investigate whether Transworld Systems Inc. and other debt collectors involved are violating federal law under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by making multiple attempts to collect the same debt from me, which may be the result of improper handling of this alleged debt. 

Additional Information : I have sent a letter directly to Transworld Systems Inc. on [ Date ], requesting the appropriate documentation, and have also forwarded a copy of my complaint to the Texas Attorney Generals Office and Transworld Systems Inc., urging them to resolve the matter in accordance with the law.

Please assist me in resolving this issue by ensuring that Transworld Systems Inc. complies with all applicable laws, including the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your assistance in resolving this dispute.

Product: Credit card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Synchrony closed all my consumer credit accounts on the same day XX/XX/year>, eliminating over $ XXXX in available credit line for no reason and the explanation provided in letters stated some internal reason about risk. This is completely unacceptable! I have had some of these accounts established for over 15Yrs! This was some computer algorithm generating account closures with no review or understanding of impact on my credit file. Loosing this amount of avialble credit along with accounts that had substantial age has negatively impacted my credit score and has made a major impact on my buying power as a consumer. The termination of my Care Credit account has impacted my families health as this card was use to help offset medical procedure expenses and we have now had to delay two planned procedures due to the loss of the $ XXXX in available credit line. As a consumer my purchasing power has been severely impacted due to the sheer trade accounts financing managed by this company. All these accounts also had SCRA protections, that I will not qualify for on a new trade account if reopened with the creditor as the customer service rep suggested on there chat service, multiple chat reps told me to just re-apply for the accounts, they should be approved as this happens all the time??? 

The following accounts were closed although I have no history of missed payments, have not exceeded the credit lines, typically pay more than the minimum due, and on several of these accounts received credit line increases just weeks before they were closed without notice or reason : Ashley Furniture ( $ XXXX credit Limit ), Lowe 's ( $ XXXX Limit ), XXXX XXXX XXXX ( $ XXXX ), Care Credit $ XXXX Limit ), Dicks Sporting Goods ( $ XXXX ), PayPal MasterCard ( $ XXXX Limit ), Sam 's Club Mastercard ( $ XXXX Limit ), Amazon ( $ XXXX Limit ), Discount Tires ( $ XXXX Limit ). The accounts were all current, with impeccable payment/usage history and none of them were over 50 % utilization! 

This was a blanket action due to some perceived internal risk caused by my accounts. No credit report info was provided on the letters so I assume my credit file was not even a factor in this action. I don't know because I can not get a straight answer from the creditor on the real reason the accounts were closed. I have a ill feeling they were closed because they had SCRA protection on them with a lower APR than I would be able to received on a new line of credit opened with them today... 


I have provided one account number for my Lowe 's account. I can provide additional account numbers but your system would only allow one. I do not want to open separate complaints for each account as all of them are managed by the same company, which should be looked into also, this is a lot of stores and brands represented by this one company who took adverse action against me for no reason across all the the brands they represent! Product: Debt collection

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
My partner passed away 4 years ago from XXXX XXXX. We were joint tenants in common and both on the deed of our home, with a transfer on death clause where the property passed solely to me when she passed. We held auto titles, bank accounts, and bills jointly. We were not married. We had a will created by a lawyer that stated the home was to pass to me and that her intention was for me to be able to continue to manage the mortgage after she passed away. The mortgage is only in her name due to the advice of the lender to not include me due to not having enough credit built up when we originally bought the house. Prior to my partner passing away, we went to the bank to sign paperwork to allow me to be able to continue to talk with the bank about the loan and they stated that I would become the successor in interest after she passed, so I thought that this was taken care of. After she passed, I submitted the death certificate to the bank and they stated I could continue to pay the mortgage off until it is paid off, which I have been doing without issue since that time. 

Within the last month, I received mail to our address that stated that because there was a discrepancy between the name listed on the mortgage ( her name ) and the name on the home owner 's insurance policy ( her name ), that they wouldn't be able to accept the payment for the home owner 's insurance, which is a problem because you have to have this in order to have a mortgage. They wouldn't provide me with any information about the mortgage on my house when I called other than I needed to apply to become a successor in interest. They stated that my options were to refinance, assume the loan, or become successor in interest. They stated that they needed evidence of my relationship to my partner and then said that they could see on the death certificate that I was listed as her partner because I was present at the time of her death and that this could be used as evidence. The person I spoke with said the death certificate wouldn't need to be submitted again because it was submitted shortly to Chase after my partner 's death. The person I spoke with said that likely the issue was that my partner 's name was removed from the home insurance ( XXXX ) and they triggered an audit. The person I spoke with said that if I could add her name or her estate to the home insurance policy it would resolve things. On the directions of this paperwork, it stated that joint tenants in common were eligible to become successors in interest, so again I assumed that it was okay. I contacted my home insurance company, who stated that they were not able to add my deceased partner 's name back on the home insurance policy, and that Chase also was not providing them with any information or accepting the paperwork. 

After submitting the paperwork at Chase bank, I then called the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX a few days later. I was told that my request was denied but that this was due to a clerical error because the death certificate was not included with the packet I submitted of the old deed, new deed, and transfer on death affidavit and that it should be approved. I received mail from Chase over that weekend that stated that my request was denied. I called the Chase XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX on Tuesday XX/XX/24 and was told that I would not be able to be successor in interest because my partner and I were not married. I was told that forced home insurance would be placed on my home because Chase couldn't accept the home insurance policy and that this would be more expensive. I was told that I wasn't allowed to know how much it would be or when it would start. I was told that I could either try to assume the loan or refinance but that none of this was guaranteed and that the mortgage interest rates were higher at this point in time than when we got our home and that there would be closing fees I would have to pay. I informed the bank that this XXXX force me out of my home depending on how much it is. I was also told that to be able to know more information about the mortgage I would need to file the will in court, become executor of the will, and then they would be able to provide me with more information. I was also told that even if I became executor, this would only work for XXXX years and that I would have to assume or refinance the loan. 

I contacted my lawyer who had created the will and he informed me that since we had no assets to distribute from the will ( everything was a jointly held asset and did not go through probate ) that we would not be able to file the will in court just for me to be able to communicate with the bank. I checked my email and saw that my home insurance company emailed that they were able to renew the home insurance policy and that the payment went through. They also added my partner 's name back to the home insurance policy. I called the Chase mortgage life events team back and the Chase home insurance team to ask about how to submit this update to the home insurance policy. The person I spoke with said that if I submitted this I could trigger a further audit and that I may be okay for this year with this issue, but likely next year I could face forced home insurance, and that it may still even happen this year. She stated that adding my partner 's name to the policy would not fix things. She couldn't fully confirm anything for me because I was not approved as the successor in interest. At this point I am overwhelmed and a nervous wreck and need assistance with this issue because I am not allowed to find out information with any certainty about my loan or continue to pay the loan as we planned for. I am not even able to be told the correct loan number for the loan. I am not able to pay my mortgage if I refinance and the interest rate goes up or more expensive forced home insurance goes on the loan. I feel that I am being forced out of my home and treated like a criminal when I call Chase and just want to be able to continue to make the mortgage payments as is and live in the home, as it is my primary residence. I am afraid that even by filing a complaint the further review will involve retaliation from Chase and them placing forced home owner insurance on my home sooner than planned.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint regarding Shell MasterCard 's handling of my account in relation to returned payments, identity theft, and the subsequent closure of my account. 

1. Timeline of Events - Returned Payments In XX/XX/year>, two auto payments on my Shell MasterCard were returned because an auto-pay setting did not reflect the current balance ; this was not due to missed payments. I have consistently made my payments on time and in full. 

- Fraud Claim : In XX/XX/year>, I reported digital unauthorized charges on my account - Account Closure : Following the report of these fraudulent charges, my Shell MasterCard account was closed in XX/XX/year>, allegedly due to the previously returned payments. 

2. Issues Faced- I have been informed that I can not reapply for a new Shell MasterCard account, despite my solid payment history prior to these events. 
- Upon contacting the Shell MasterCard executive office, I spoke with the person handling my case, who informed me that my account was being closed and made a statement regarding racial discrimination. When I requested to speak to her supervisor, she claimed she didnt have one. 
- After following up with the executive office, I was informed that she did, in fact, have a supervisor and that my case would be assigned to another representative. 

3. Dispute Over Fraudulent Charges - Despite identifying fraudulent charges on my account, I have encountered ongoing billing issues related to these charges, which has further exacerbated my financial distress. 

Consumer Laws Involved - I am aware of my rights under various consumer protection laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). I urge Shell MasterCard to comply with these laws when addressing my case. 

I respectfully request the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to investigate my complaint against Shell MasterCard and scrutinize their practices regarding my situation, particularly in relation to account management and the consequences of identity theft.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  I went to PNC to conduct some business : deposit a number of checks ( pension, rental checks ). And, to make a withdrawal during this transaction. As usual, I provided my Driver License. It was accepted as it ALWAYS is. The teller made one transaction then I was asked for a 2nd form of ID. I questioned the need for a 2nd form of ID as I have been banking here for decades & a DL was the accepted mode necessary. I was told 2 forms of ID were necessary. I requested to speak w/the manager as I needed to know what changed & why. I was directed to speak to the manager. 
We had a conversation & I was told it was a fairly 'new ' protocol. W/this managers assistance I completed all my business : deposits & withdrawal using my DL. I went home & relayed my experience to my family member, stating they wld need 2 forms of ID. They were quizzical. I have not been back to PNC since XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX 

On XXXX XXXX XXXX, I called what I thought was their corporate number ( XXXX ) to get info re this issue : if the policy changed, was it implemented in all stores for all customers, if it changed why weren't customers informed. I was given the run-around. I was advised the number was for customer care & someone wld call me back in 3 bizness days. I expressly stated I wanted to escalate this up. ( I called on XXXX XXXX bc I wanted to go to PNC & conduct business but was not tolerating more issues as it relates. I wanted to get clarity before I returned to conduct business @ PNC ) On XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX a rep from PNC returned my call. It was NOT corporate as I had requested. It was customer care who was kind, professional but cld NOT explain what took place, why & if it were across the board. I was told my concerns were noted. And, that 2 forms of ID were required. I told the rep 'No, I've banked here a very long time & my valid DL had been sufficient ) ( My concerns were not addressed ). 

In the last 3 weeks, a family member w/PNC accounts has gone to the same PNC three ( 3 ) times & the only ID she needed to show was the 1 ID, her DL. Three times she has gone since my experience on XXXX XXXX XXXX. It shld be stated I have more accounts than she does at PNC yet I was told I needed 2 forms of ID. I do not have an ATM or Debit card. Why is this so called policy unfairly applied? If there is now a requirement of 2 forms of ID : why were customers not told? Clearly, it is not applied fairly or my decades long requirement of a photo DL wld suffice. I'm filing this complaint bc PNC has failed to give me an adequate response. AND, bc my family member has gone 3 times since my experience & 1 form of ID ( a DL ) was sufficient. 
When talking to customer care on XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, they stated 2 forms of ID is required. I challenged that & stated NO, it absolutely is not. I've been banking at PNC before it became PNC. It was XXXX XXXX XXXX. And, my DL has been sufficient for decades. 

I was going to file a complaint months ago when I went to another PNC, deposited over {$7000.00} in funds ( pension, rent checks ) & wanted {$1300.00} back. I was asked for another form of ID then ... .I didn't even answer. Because if you can take {$7000.00} to deposit using my ONE ID ( DL ) then surely they can withdraw {$1300.00} from those funds. On that date, I conducted my business & left. ( I don't regularly use that PNC so I let is slide ). But, if I need to show more than 1 form of ID, everyone best have to show more than 1 ID as well.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, My name is XXXX XXXX, from XXXX XXXX XXXX. I received an XXXX XXXX XXXXt ( XXXX ) check from the IRS in the amount of {$170000.00}. My previous company had to close due to XXXX. Consequently, I opened a new company in New Jersey and a new bank account ( account number XXXX ) where I deposited the check. According to IRS guidelines, XXXX is available for closed companies as well. However, this account was subsequently closed by Chase 's fraud team. 

I have submitted all necessary documents to verify both my old company 's information and my own. During my first call to Chase, the representative inquired about the amount and I explained that it was the XXXX from the IRS, similar to a tax refund. I was assured that the account would be released within XXXX business days, but this did not happen. 

Upon my second call, I was instructed to change the address on the account since it differed from the one on the check. I complied and paid {$300.00} for the address change, but the account was still not released even the representative promised. As a result, I had to create another new account ( account number XXXX ). 
Chase wants me to call IRS to verify the check and the company but it is impossible to contact them as you know. This sounds incredibly frustrating. Trying to reach the IRS can feel like an endless maze. 

Please release my funds as soon as possible. My company is currently facing financial difficulties, and the release of these funds is critical. 

Sincerely, XXXX.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Under the authority of 15 USC 1692C ( C ), I am formally notifying you that I refuse to pay the above-referenced debt. Additionally, I demand an immediate cease of all forms of communication regarding this account. This includes communication via telephone, email, text message, or reporting the account on my consumer credit report. The only communication I permit is via written correspondence mailed to my address solely to confirm the permanent deletion of this account from all records. Furthermore, I am disputing this debt and formally requesting a complete method of verification for this account. I am deeply concerned about the validity and accuracy of the information being reported. Specifically, I demand answers to the following : Details of Investigation : What evidence did your representatives uncover that led them to conclude this account is being reported accurately and legally? Certified Documents Reviewed : What certified documents were obtained to validate this account? Please provide copies. Investigation Communication : Provide a complete copy of all information transmitted to the data furnisher as part of the investigation. XXXX Costs : What were the costs incurred by your company to obtain documents necessary for this investigation? Communication with XXXX XXXX : Did your representatives directly communicate with the party reporting this information? If yes : a. Who was contacted? b. What was their role? c. When was the contact made? d. What was the nature and duration of the conversation? XXXX XXXX : Provide details about the employee ( XXXX ) involved in the investigation : a. 
Name and position. b. Length of employment with your company. c. Training provided to them for handling disputes of this nature. Documentation : Copies of all correspondence, emails, or communication related to the investigation. Proof of the timely procurement of all required certified documents. Delinquency Details : Provide the specific date the delinquency commenced and the expected date of cessation of reporting for this account. I also request that your response include a notarized affidavit attesting to the accuracy and completeness of the information provided. Note that any form-letter or template response will be deemed unacceptable, as my dispute is specific and demands a case-by-case review. If you can not provide ALL of the above information in a timely and complete manner as required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and related consumer protection laws, I demand the immediate permanent removal of this account from all records. Case Law Supporting This Dispute Henson v. Santander Consumer USA Inc., 137 S. Ct. 1718 ( 2017 ) : Established that debt collectors must adhere strictly to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), including rules around permissible communication and disputes. Spokeo , Inc. v. Robins, 578 U.S. 330 ( 2016 ) : Emphasizes the importance of accuracy and completeness in consumer reporting and the need for thorough investigation and validation when a consumer disputes information. Richardson v. Fleet Bank of Massachusetts, 190 F. Supp. 2d 81 ( D. Mass. 2001 ) : Held that debt collectors must conduct meaningful investigations when disputes are raised, and failure to do so can result in liability under the FCRA. Saunders v. Branch Banking & Trust Co., 526 F.3d 142 ( 4th Cir. 2008 ) : Affirmed the right of consumers to hold furnishers liable for failing to investigate disputes accurately and properly. Failure to comply with this notice will result in further action, including complaints filed with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and potential legal action to enforce my rights under federal law. I trust you will handle this matter promptly and in compliance with the law.
