Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Keep getting calls about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I took private student loans from Navient from XXXX. I was not working and did not have good credit at the time so my mother co-signed the loans for me. Once I graduated, I put forth best efforts to repay the loan. However, I had severe financial struggles and needed multiple forbearances. I lost my mother in XXXX and was told that I was no longer eligible for forbearances because I maxed out. When I explained to them that my mother died and I was experiencing health issues, they told me that I had to make a payment or I'd default, I started paying them with credit cards to prevent default. In XXXX, I applied for and was granted XXXX  XXXX bankruptcy but my attorney refused to argue for student loan forgiveness in the separate hearing. I could not afford another attorney to handle the special hearing for student loans. Navient did not acknowledge my mother 's death until XXXX when I received a letter from them saying they recently learned of her death although I'd been telling them for years. My struggles with Navient lasted from XXXX  through XXXX when I could no longer afford my payments and refused to pay interest only. My total loan balances ballooned from the initial {$14000.00} to over {$41000.00}. I spoke to multiple representatives during this time about their predatory lending practices and offered to pay the amount I borrowed if they would remove all of the years of interest they had tacked on. I argued that even when I made payments, my balances continued to increase. They offered to settle for 60 % of the balance, to be paid in three installments. The amount was unfair and I explained that I did not have that type of money to pay them. I stopped taking their calls and Navient then started calling people associated with my and disclosing the matter to them, violating my privacy. They left a detailed voicemail on my sister 's phone. They called my husband and disclosed the matter to him, and I was not married when these loans were taken. He was not aware of the matter. The also left messages on my son 's phone. They started reaching out to past employers as well. During this time, they threatened me with legal action. Finally, when trying to embarrass me did not work, and threatening legal action did not work, they sold me loan to a debt collector. I feel I have made enough payments over the years that my loan should have been considered settled or even written off. Not sent to a collection agency to further harm my credit, after multiple offers from myself to try to resolve the matter. Their practices are illegal and unjust. 

Disbursements - {$14000.00} XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  - {$2000.00} XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  - {$5500.00} - withdrew XX/XX/XXXX - {$2000.00}- withdrew XX/XX/XXXX - {$2000.00} XX/XX/XXXX - $ XXXX not enrolled

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) Subject : Formal Complaint Against Equifax for FCRA Violations and Misrepresentation Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am submitting this formal complaint against Equifax for violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) concerning inaccurate and misrepresented information on my credit report. Despite my repeated efforts to address these inaccuracies, Equifax has failed to correct the errors and continues to report misleading information regarding an account with the Department of EducationXXXX XXXX Account Number XXXX ). 

Summary of Dispute The account in question is being reported inconsistently by Equifax and other credit bureaus, including XXXX. Equifax provided a report ( Report Number XXXX, Date Generated : XX/XX/XXXX ), stating that the disputed item was verified. However, the details of the payment history differ significantly : Equifaxs Report shows 90-day late payments for XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX Report shows 90-day late payments for XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 
These discrepancies are not minor ; they are clear errors and misrepresentations of my payment history. Furthermore, no report correctly represents the progression of late payments ( 30 days, 60 days, 90 days ). I have never been late as described, and this false reporting violates my rights under the FCRA. Legal Violations Under the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq.
), Equifax has specific legal obligations to ensure the accuracy and fairness of consumer reporting. The violations in this case include : Section 1681e ( b ) : Failure to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information. 
Section 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Failure to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information and correct or delete inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information within 30 days.

Section 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) : Failure to delete or modify disputed information that can not be verified or is found to be inaccurate. 
These failures constitute a significant violation of my consumer rights, as Equifax is knowingly reporting conflicting and inaccurate information, thereby damaging my creditworthiness. 

Request for Immediate Action I demand the following actions be taken immediately to address this ongoing misrepresentation : Immediate Deletion of the Account : If Equifax can not provide concrete documentation validating the accuracy of the disputed account, including the name and employee number of the individual who verified the information, this account must be removed from my credit report. I am not requesting an automated XXXXXXXX review but a detailed explanation of the validation process. 
Provision of Validation Documentation : Equifax must provide all documents and evidence used to verify the accuracy of this account, including direct communication with the furnisher of the information. 
Investigation by the CFPB : I request the CFPB to thoroughly investigate Equifax for its repeated violations of the FCRA and failure to uphold its legal obligations. 
Legal Precedent Supporting My Case FTC vXXXX Equifax Credit Information Services , Inc., XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX : This case highlighted the responsibility of credit reporting agencies to ensure accurate reporting and the consequences of failing to address consumer disputes appropriately. 
FTC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Civil Action No. XXXX : Demonstrated the accountability of credit bureaus for inaccuracies and the need for reasonable investigation procedures. 
Conclusion Equifaxs continued misrepresentation of this account and its failure to conduct a proper investigation into my dispute are clear violations of the FCRA. These actions have caused undue harm to my financial standing and must be addressed immediately. 

I trust the CFPB will take swift and decisive action to hold Equifax accountable and ensure compliance with federal laws designed to protect consumers like myself. 

Please contact me if additional documentation or information is required to assist in your investigation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Transworld Systems Inc. Violating Debt Collection Laws I am submitting this complaint regarding Transworld Systems Inc. ( TSI ) for violating my rights under XXXX  law and the federal Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). TSI has repeatedly sent me letters attempting to collect on an alleged debt, as shown in the attached document. Despite my clear requests for debt validation, they have failed to provide the required documentation to validate the legitimacy of the alleged debt. 

Under the FDCPA, debt collectors are required to cease collection efforts until they have validated the debt upon request. TSI has continued to send collection letters without ever responding to my requests for validation. This constitutes harassment and a violation of my consumer rights under both state and federal law. 

I do not owe the alleged debt, and TSIs refusal to validate the debt while continuing collection attempts has caused significant frustration and distress. I request that the CFPB investigate Transworld Systems Inc. for its practices, require them to validate the alleged debt or cease all collection efforts, and ensure compliance with all relevant debt collection laws.

Attached is the most recent letter I received from TSI, which further demonstrates their ongoing refusal to validate the alleged debt. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Dispute and Request for Investigation of Inaccurate Credit Reporting To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute and request an investigation into the inaccurate reporting of my XXXX XXXX account ( Account Number : XXXX ) and its subsequent transfer to Nelnet ( Account Number : XXXX ). Specifically, the payment history reflects errors that significantly misrepresent my financial record. 

According to the reports, my XXXX XXXX account indicates that I was 90 days late in XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year>. However, the account never accurately reflects a progression of delinquency from 30 days late to 60 days late and then to 90 days late, as required by standard reporting practices. Furthermore, the account was closed due to a transfer to Nelnet, yet the misrepresentation persists. 

This reporting error violates my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) [ 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. ], which mandates that credit reporting agencies and furnishers of credit information must ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. This inaccurate reporting has caused undue harm to my credit profile, and I am demanding immediate rectification of this error.

Additionally, I am aware of prior lawsuits and complaints against Nelnet concerning the misrepresentation of consumers ' accounts and erroneous credit reporting practices. For instance : Case Example : Lawsuits allege Nelnet 's failure to maintain accurate account records and properly update credit reporting agencies, which mirrors the issues I am currently experiencing. 
Violation Allegation : Misrepresentation of payment history and account status, as in my case, has led to widespread consumer harm, further supporting the need for immediate corrective action. 
I respectfully request the following actions : Immediate Correction : Amend the payment history for the referenced accounts to reflect accurate information.

Verification of Accuracy : Conduct a thorough investigation into the reporting discrepancies and provide a detailed explanation of your findings.

Notification to Credit Bureaus : Inform all credit reporting agencies of the corrections to ensure my credit profile accurately reflects my account status.

Please consider this communication a formal complaint under the FCRA. If the requested corrections are not made promptly, I reserve the right to escalate this matter further, including but not limited to seeking legal remedies. 

I trust that you will give this matter the urgent attention it deserves. I expect a written response detailing the steps taken to resolve this issue within 30 days of receiving this letter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, New Jersey XXXX Account # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Attention : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX Per the Federal Credit Reporting Act as a federally protected consumer, per 15 USC 6802 XXXX XXXX, I am now OPTING OUT of ANY AND ALL Authorization I, the consumer may have given to XXXX XXXX, XXXX written, unwritten, verbal or non-verbal to report my nonpublic personal information. 

XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX.violates the Privacy Act of 1974 as well as 12 CFR 1022.24 Reasonable opportunity to opt-out because I was never notified by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX.that my nonpublic personal information was going to be shared with non-affiliated third parties such as XXXX XXXX XXXX Promotional Inquiry, I was NEVER GIVEN THE CHANCE TO OPT OUT. Also, 15 USC 6508 states that I have the option to opt out of any account reported to my credit report and I am supposed to receive an opt-out notice every thirty ( 30 ) days which XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX never sent to me. I am exercising my rights under 16 CFR 313.7 Form of opt-out notice to consumers. 

XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX.violated the terms and conditions within their banking agreement, because XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX states that they do not provide consumer information to third parties which they violated by reporting my nonpublic personal information to the credit reporting agencies listed above. According to 15 USC 6802 B ) I am supposed to receive THREE disclosures before my nonpublic personal information is shared but I never received notice. XXXX XXXX, XXXXALSO unlawfully sold this debt to a third party AFTER the debt had already been tendered in accordance with UCC 3-603 et al. I have never had a contract or agreement with any third parties and I do NOT consent to them reporting any account to my credit report. I am invoking all rights under OPT OUT and to Privacy protected by 15 USC 6802 B, 12 CFR 1022.24, 15 USC 6508, 16 CFR 313.7, the Privacy Act of 1974 et al. Please see 15 USC 6802 B ) OPT OUT below. A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless ( A ) such financial institution clearly and conspicuously discloses to the consumer, in writing or in electronic form or other form permitted by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, that such information may be disclosed to such third party ; ( B ) the consumer is given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and ( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. Finally, XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXis in clear violation of 15 USC 45 - Unfair methods of competition for their failure to update the records after receiving tender of the full balance of the debt in accordance with the Electronic Funds Transfer Act as well as their acts of securities fraud and Tax evasion which I intend to report XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX IRS form XXXX. To conclude, the above-listed credit reporting agencies are in violation of 15 USC 1681 sec 604a section 2, because it states that a Consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account w/o my written instruction. I did NOT give consent nor written instruction to report the XXXX XXXX, XXXX.account XXXX and supporting nonpublic personal information such as the transaction history and balance. Also, The credit reporting agencies are in violation of 15 USC 1681 sec 604a section 2, because it states that a Consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account w/o my written instruction. I did NOT give consent nor written instruction to any credit agency to report my nonpublic personal information. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

I am writing to file a formal complaint against Rozlin financial Group LLC for failing to provide the legally required debt validation information in response to my request, in violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

On XXXX XXXX, I sent Rozlin financial Group LLC a written request for validation of a debt they claim I owe. The letter was sent via certified mail with a return receipt requested, and it was delivered on XXXX XXXX. Despite allowing ample time for a response, Rozlin financial Group LLC has failed to provide any of the requested validation, which includes : 1. Proof that I owe the debt and that the amount is accurate.

2. The name and contact information of the original creditor.

3. Documentation showing their legal authority to collect the debt.

Additionally, despite failing to validate the debt, Rozlin financial Group LLC has [ describe any actions, such as continuing collection efforts, threatening legal action, or reporting the debt to credit bureaus, if applicable ]. These actions violate my rights under Section 809 ( b ) of the FDCPA and have caused me unnecessary stress and harm.

Issue: Problem with fraud alerts or security freezes
Consumer complaint narrative:
We have a credit freeze w/TransUnion. Friday, starting at about XXXX XXXX  I tried to lift the freeze using their online system while I was online with a merchant. After I logged in, their website sent a code to my email address. After about 5 minutes ( did not time the wait ), since there was no " resend '' option on the web page, I closed the web page and attempted to login again. This time, I timed 10 minutes and when I had not received an email, I tried to login again- the THIRD time, with NO prior warning, I was told my account was locked. The web site gave a phone number to call ; but the office was closed. 

I sent them a message on XXXX, and received back a pointer to their website and a indication that I would get a response within 72 BUSINESS HOURS. 

25 minutes after the initial request for a code, the code showed up in my email. Message headers indicate the message was not SENT until 22 minutes after my first login attenot. 

Saturday morning, I tried to log in again ; but the account was still locked. I spent 15 minutes on hold and then was disconnected - I'm now on hold again.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Issue: Problems at the end of the loan or lease
Sub-issue: Unable to receive car title or other problem after the loan is paid off
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am submitting this formal complaint regarding my loan with XXXX XXXX and the unresolved situation surrounding my totaled XXXX XXXX XXXX. Despite clear communication about the total loss status of my vehicle and the presence of GAP insurance coverage, Westlake Finance has failed to finalize the loan and collect the car. This has resulted in ongoing confusion and improper demands for payments, which I am seeking help to resolve. 

Key Issues : Car Totaled in Accident ( XX/XX/XXXX ) : On XX/XX/XXXX, my XXXX XXXX XXXX was involved in an accident caused by another driver. The at-fault driver had liability insurance through XXXX, who assessed the vehicles value at {$16000.00} and declared it a total loss. I have attached the total loss letter from XXXX as proof of the vehicles totaled status. 

Failure to Finalize Loan and Collect the Car : Westlake Finance has been informed that my car was totaled, and I have communicated the total loss to them. On XX/XX/XXXX, I was told by a representative from Westlake Finance that they would pick up the vehicle. However, as of today, the car has not been collected, and I have not received any further communication explaining the delay or the next steps. This failure to follow through is causing unnecessary confusion and financial strain. 

GAP Insurance : Westlake Finance has GAP insurance on the loan, which should cover any remaining balance between the insurance payout and the loan amount. This should have been applied to finalize the loan balance, but instead, I am being asked to make continued payments on a car that is no longer in my possession. I have provided proof of the XXXX insurance payout and the GAP insurance policy, which should resolve the remaining balance on the loan. 

Continued Requests for Payments on a Totaled Car : Despite the car being declared totaled by Geico, Westlake Finance continues to demand monthly payments. I should not be responsible for payments on a car that is no longer in use, and I expect the loan to be settled with the insurance payout and GAP insurance coverage. 

Inconsistent Communication and Unresolved Issues : I have made multiple calls to Westlake Finance, but each time I receive conflicting information. Some representatives tell me that the car will be picked up soon, while others indicate that the loan can not be finalized until the vehicle is physically collected. I have not received any clear timeline for when the car will be collected, nor any resolution on how the loan will be paid off.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Credit monitoring or identity theft protection services
Sub-issue: Problem canceling credit monitoring or identify theft protection service
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX of XXXX, I signed up with Kikoff for a background check service to rent a house ( {$15.00} I believe ). I did not realize at the time that it also signed me up for a credit monitoring service at the same time that I did not want. 

After the initial cost, I started getting emails to pay for my subscription credit monitoring service. I tried canceling numerous ways, but got no response. I did not make any additional payments and never used the service. 

I may have gotten a couple additional requests to pay, but then all communication stopped and I believed the service ended. 

Instead, they were billing me in secret. While the total amount wasn't much ( ~ {$55.00} ) eventually they reported me to the credit agencies for being in default without notifying me, which wrecked my credit score. Their service is effectively blackmail.

Once I found out about this ( from a separate background check ) in XXXX of XXXX, I disputed the charges reached out to the company. Their only response was that nothing could be done. Even paying the past due amount could not get the black mark on my credit history removed.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
ABILITY RECOVERY SERVICE XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Subject : Formal Debt Validation Request and Credit Report Dispute under XXXX XXXX Compliance and Federal Law Account Number : XXXX To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the account referenced above, which is being reported on my credit file by your agency. This account is in violation of XXXX XXXX compliance standards and federal credit reporting laws under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681 ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692 ). 

Despite my previous disputes, you have continued reporting this collection account to credit bureaus without sufficient validation of the debt, thereby violating the accuracy and compliance requirements of XXXX XXXX standards. Under these laws, I am exercising my right to request the following : 1. Validation of the debt in full compliance with the FDCPA : A copy of the original agreement with my wet-ink signature proving I agreed to this debt. 
A detailed accounting of the original balance and how it reached the amount of {$520.00}. 
Documentation proving that your agency has the legal right to collect this debt. 
2. XXXX XXXX Compliance Documentation : Confirm that this account is being reported correctly and in full compliance with XXXX XXXX reporting guidelines, including accurate status codes and permissible dates. 
3. Immediate Action to Cease Reporting Until Verified : As this account remains disputed and unverified, you must cease reporting to credit bureaus immediately under 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ).

Failure to comply with these requests within 30 days will result in legal action, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ). I may also seek damages for harm caused by false reporting under 15 U.S.C. 1681n and 1681o. 

If you are unable to provide the requested documentation, this account must be deleted from all credit reports. Continued failure to comply will leave me no choice but to pursue legal remedies, including a lawsuit for violations of the FCRA and FDCPA.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative: On the XXXX of XXXX I visited an ATM inside of the Chase bank at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX. I deposited {$2900.00} in cash, and did not receive a receipt. During that same transaction, the atm rejected one of my {$100.00} bills intended for deposit. I then physically entered the branch and deposited the {$100.00} bill with a bank teller. Upon checking my bank account online immediately thereafter to see that my deposit was confirmed, no amount showed in my bank account. I then spoke to the branch manager, XXXX XXXX who informed me that I would need to call the claims department of Chases customer service. I did so, and received a temporary credit in the amount of {$2900.00} on the XXXX of XXXX in my bank account until my claim was corroborated. I was given no other information. On the XXXX of XXXX ( today ) I checked my account to find that the temporary amount of {$2900.00} credited to my account on the XXXX of XXXX had been reversed. I called the claims department, and was told that an audit had been done on the ATM, and there was no discrepancy found. I was then told to go back to the branch, and speak to the branch manager if I had further questions. I returned to that branch today and spoke with a chase associate, XXXX XXXX, as the branch manager was on vacation- I was helped, and the associate called the help line. I spoke with another person who told me the same information, and I requested video footage. I was told that footage would have to be subpoenaed, and that there was nothing else they could do. Please assist me in resolving this bank error and/or issuing a subpoena for the atm footage from XX/XX/year>.

Consumer complaint narrative: Starting XX/XX/year>XXXX  I filed a claim for fraud on my account due to unrecognized charges on my XXXX XXXX account, My bank ( Chase bank ) asked me questions like if I had my credentials and if I couldve known who couldve done it and if they needed any more information an investigator would contact me.Then they froze my bank account and sent me a new card and told me that if the claim is valid I will receive temporary funds within 2 days. I received the temporary funds in my account XX/XX/year> and on XX/XX/year> the funds were out of the processing phase and was fully in my account and was refunded to me as a reversal. Radio silence from XXXX XXXX  and no one reached out to me from chase bank in regards to more information or an update on my account and on XX/XX/year>XXXX  starting at XXXX the money I was refunded back to me from chase bank was being withdrawn back to XXXX XXXX with no explanation, no phone call, no email or text to give me an explanation. At XXXXXXXX XXXX on XX/XX/year> I had contacted chase bank through a phone call and spoke with a representative, they had unprofessionally told me that I was in the wrong and its my fault that my money was sent back to XXXX XXXX saying first that my claim was counterfeit and after I requested documentation or a reason why it was counterfeit he changed it to my claim being invalid. I asked for a reason why my fully refunded money was transferred back to XXXX XXXX  and he kept deflecting the question and kept repeating that my claim my invalid so I asked why refund me the money if the claim was invalid and the response was we can not assume a claim is invalid when received it doesnt make sense since I answered all their questions and I was told it was a valid claim. I asked to speak to a manager or someone higher up and he refused and once I urged the representative to give me straight answer he said that XXXX reopen the investigation and the call was over since the information I requested was being held from me. After getting in contact with XXXX XXXX the representative on their side told me chase bank never reached out to them and it would be 10 business days for an update email on my claim but its been 12 days and the representative kept repeating that until I decided the call was over. At XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> I called chases claims department again and a more experienced representative spoke with me and told me that they had reached out to XXXX XXXX twice and XXXX XXXX  counter claimed against me with documents stating since Ive used their services before and havent had issues or reported any other transactions with their services that the claim was invalid and due to chase bank policy that had to transfer my refunded money back to XXXX XXXX, I couldnt get the documents myself since its still pending review and the investigation was not reopened by the earlier representative. So Im at a loss now, my account is negative and I keep getting charged an overdraft fee because chase wont fight for my money or help me at all due to * policy *

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Mortgage
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Credit Protection and Payment Mismanagement To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding my experience with XXXX  XXXX  and the subsequent transfer to PHH Mortgage during my ongoing loss mitigation process. 

For over a year, I have been engaged in a loss mitigation process with XXXX XXXX. As part of this process, I was instructed to make a mortgage payment of {$1500.00} for XX/XX/year>. Despite being advised to proceed with this payment, I later discovered that my loan was transferred to PHH Mortgage after the payment was processed. 

Upon reviewing my statement, I noticed that the payment was not applied to my mortgage account. I initially assumed that the payment was being held until the loss mitigation process was resolved. However, it has come to my attention that this payment has not reflected in my overall mortgage balance. 

I was approved for a partial payment option with an agreed mortgage amount of {$1400.00}. However, to my dismay, PHH Mortgage is now requesting a payment of {$1500.00}, less than a month after this agreement was established. This sudden increase in the payment amount is both confusing and concerning. 

I have contacted PHH Mortgage multiple times seeking clarification on the status of my payment and why it was accepted while I was still in the loss mitigation process. Unfortunately, I have yet to receive a satisfactory explanation regarding the whereabouts of my payment. 

Despite my repeated requests for information via phone, email, and mail, there has been no response from PHH Mortgage. This lack of communication and transparency is deeply concerning and has left me feeling frustrated and uncertain about my mortgage situation. 

I kindly request immediate attention to this matter and a thorough explanation of where my payment has gone, the rationale behind accepting it during the loss mitigation process, and the reason for the sudden increase in my payment amount. Thank you for your prompt attention to this issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX Acct # XXXX
